mx.styles.IAdvancedStyleClient
classes.description: This interface describes the advanced properties that a component must implement to fully participate in the advanced style subsystem.

classes.name: mx.styles.ISimpleStyleClient
classes.description: This interface describes the properties and methods that an object must implement so that it can participate in the style subsystem. This interface is intended to be used by classes that obtain their style values from other objects rather than through locally set values and type selectors. This interface is implemented by ProgrammaticSkin.

classes.name: mx.styles.IStyleClient
classes.description:
This interface describes the properties and methods that an object must implement so that it can fully participate in the style subsystem. This interface is implemented by UIComponent.

If the object does not need to store style values locally, it can implement the ISimpleStyleClient interface instead.

classes.name: mx.styles.IStyleManager
classes.description:
The IStyleManager class manages the following:
  • Which CSS style properties the class inherits
  • Which style properties are colors, and therefore get special handling
  • A list of strings that are aliases for color values
This interface was used by Flex 2.0.1. Flex 3 now uses IStyleManager2 instead.

classes.name: mx.styles.IStyleManager2
classes.description:
The IStyleManager2 class manages the following:
  • Which CSS style properties the class inherits
  • Which style properties are colors, and therefore get special handling
  • A list of strings that are aliases for color values

classes.name: mx.styles.StyleManager
classes.description:
The StyleManager class manages the following:
  • Which CSS style properties the class inherits
  • Which style properties are colors, and therefore get special handling
  • A list of strings that are aliases for color values

classes.name: mx.styles.StyleProxy
classes.description: Wraps an object that implements the IAdvancedStyleClient interface. This interface supports a filterMap property that contains style-source/style-destination pairs.

classes.name: mx.text.TextFormat
classes.description: This class holds text related styles See: See:

classes.name: mx.utils.ArrayUtil
classes.description: The ArrayUtil utility class is an all-static class with methods for working with arrays within Flex. You do not create instances of ArrayUtil; instead you call static methods such as the ArrayUtil.toArray() method.

classes.name: mx.utils.Base64Decoder
classes.description: A utility class to decode a Base64 encoded String to a ByteArray.

classes.name: mx.utils.Base64Encoder
classes.description: A utility class to encode a String or ByteArray as a Base64 encoded String.

classes.name: mx.utils.BitFlagUtil

classes.name: mx.utils.HexEncoder
classes.description: Documentation is not currently available. Ported to ActionScript from flex/messaging/util/Hex.java

classes.name: mx.utils.IXMLNotifiable
classes.description: The IXMLNotifiable interface.

classes.name: mx.utils.ObjectProxy
mx.utils.ObjectUtil
classes.description: The ObjectUtil class is an all-static class with methods for working with Objects within Flex. You do not create instances of ObjectUtil; instead you simply call static methods such as the ObjectUtil.isSimple() method. JS PAYG : non-reflectable utility class, unused methods will be subject to deadcode elimination

classes.name: mx.utils.PopUpUtil
classes.description: Helper functionality for working with pop-ups.

classes.name: mx.utils.RPCStringUtil
classes.description: The RPCStringUtil class is a subset of StringUtil, removing methods that create dependency issues when RPC messages are in a bootstrap loader.

classes.name: mx.utils.RPCUIDUtil
classes.description: The RPCUIDUtil class is a copy of UIDUtil without some functions that cause dependency problems when RPC messages are put in a bootstrap loader.

classes.name: mx.utils.StringUtil
classes.description: The StringUtil utility class is an all-static class with methods for working with String objects within Flex. You do not create instances of StringUtil; instead you call methods such as the StringUtil.substitute() method.

classes.name: mx.utils.UIDUtil
classes.description:
The UIDUtil class is an all-static class with methods for working with UIDs (unique identifiers) within Flex. You do not create instances of UIDUtil; instead you simply call static methods such as the UIDUtil.createUID() method.

Note: If you have a dynamic object that has no [Bindable] properties (which force the object to implement the IUID interface), Flex adds an mx_internal_uid property that contains a UID to the object. To avoid having this field in your dynamic object, make it [Bindable], implement the IUID interface in the object class, or set a uid property with a value.

classes.name: mx.utils.URLUtil
classes.description: The URLUtil class is a static class with methods for working with full and relative URLs within Flex.

classes.name: mx.utils.XMLNotifier
classes.description: Used for watching changes to XML and XMLList objects. Those objects are not EventDispatchers, so if multiple elements want to watch for changes they need to go through this mechanism. Call watchXML(), passing in the same notification function that you would pass to XML.notification. Use unwatchXML() to remove that notification.

classes.name: mx.utils.XMLUtil
classes.description: The XMLUtil class is an all-static class with methods for working with XML within Flex. You do not create instances of XMLUtil; instead you simply call static methods such as the XMLUtil.qnamesEqual() method.

classes.name: mx.validators.DateValidator
mx.validators.EmailValidator
mx.validators.IValidator
classes.description:
This interface specifies the methods and properties that a Validator object must implement.

This interface allows to validate multiple data types like numbers, currency, phone numbers, zip codes etc that are defined in both mx and spark namespaces. The classes mx:Validator and spark:GlobaliationValidatorBase implement this interface. The validateAll() method in these classes use this interface type to call the validate() method on multiple validator objects.

classes.name: mx.validators.IValidatorListener
classes.description: The interface that components implement to support the Flex data validation mechanism. The UIComponent class implements this interface. Therefore, any subclass of UIComponent also implements it.

classes.name: mx.validators.NumberValidator
mx.validators.NumberValidatorDomainType
classes.description: The NumberValidatorDomainType class defines the values for the domain property of the NumberValidator class.

classes.name: mx.validators.PhoneNumberValidator
mx.validators.RegExpValidationResult
classes.description:
The RegExpValidator class dispatches the valid and invalid events. For an invalid event, the event object is an instance of the ValidationResultEvent class, and the ValidationResultEvent.results property contains an Array of ValidationResult objects.

However, for a valid event, the ValidationResultEvent.results property contains an Array of RegExpValidationResult objects. The RegExpValidationResult class is a child class of the ValidationResult class, and contains additional properties used with regular expressions.

classes.name: mx.validators.RegExpValidator
mx.validators.StringValidator
mx.validators.ValidationResult
classes.description:
The ValidationResult class contains the results of a validation.

The ValidationResultEvent class defines the event object that is passed to event listeners for the valid and invalid validator events. The class also defines the results property, which contains an Array of ValidationResult objects, one for each field examined by the validator. This lets you access the ValidationResult objects from within an event listener.

classes.name: mx.validators.Validator
org.apache.royale.binding.ApplicationDataBinding
classes.description: The ApplicationDataBinding class implements databinding for Application instances. When you want to use databinding within the MXML file that has Application as its root tag, include the ApplicationDataBinding tag as well.  Different classes can have different databinding implementation that optimize for the different lifecycles.  For example, an item renderer databinding implementation can wait to execute databindings until the data property is set.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.binding.ChainBinding

classes.name: org.apache.royale.binding.ConstantBinding

classes.name: org.apache.royale.binding.ContainerDataBinding
classes.description: The ContainerDataBinding class implements databinding for Container instances.  Place a ContainerDataBinding tag into the MXML file that has Container as its root tag. Different classes can have different databinding implementation that optimize for the different lifecycles.  For example, an item renderer databinding implementation can wait to execute databindings until the data property is set.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.binding.DataBindingBase
classes.description: The DataBindingBase class is the base class for custom data binding implementations that can be cross-compiled.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.binding.GenericBinding

Different classes can have different databinding implementation that optimize for the different lifecycles.  For example, an item renderer databinding implementation can wait to execute databindings until the data property is set.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.binding.ItemRendererSimpleBinding
classes.description: The SimpleBinding class is lightweight data-binding class that is optimized for simple assignments of one object's property to another object's property.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.binding.MXMLBeadViewDataBinding
classes.description: The MXMLBeadViewDataBinding class implements databinding for MXMLBeadView instances.  Different classes can have different databinding implementation that optimize for the different lifecycles.  For example, an item renderer databinding implementation can wait to execute databindings until the data property is set.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.binding.PropertyWatcher
classes.description: The PropertyWatcher class is the data-binding class that watches for changes to various properties in objects.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.binding.SimpleBinding
classes.description: The SimpleBinding class is lightweight data-binding class that is optimized for simple assignments of one object's property to another object's property.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.binding.ViewDataBinding
classes.description: The ViewDataBinding class implements databinding for View instances.  Different classes can have different databinding implementation that optimize for the different lifecycles.  For example, an item renderer databinding implementation can wait to execute databindings until the data property is set.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.binding.WatcherBase
classes.description: The WatcherBase class is the base class for data-binding classes that watch various properties and styles for changes.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.BarChart
classes.description: The BarChart class draws a multi-series graph of data using vertical columns. The series property is an array of BarChartSeries instances that represent the data in the model.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.ColumnChart
classes.description: The ColumnChart displays a histogram chart where each series in in the chart is a vertical column placed side by side.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.LineChart
classes.description: The LineChart displays a series of line graphs with optional graphics at each vertex.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.PieChart
classes.description: The PieChart displays data as a percentage of pie.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.StackedBarChart
classes.description: The StackedBarChart displays a histogram chart where each series in the chart is stack next to each other.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.StackedColumnChart
classes.description: The StackedColumnChart displays a histogram chart where each series in the chart is stack on top of each other.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.AxisBaseBead
classes.description: The AxisBaseBead is the base class for the chart axis beads.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.ChartItemRendererFactory
classes.description: The ChartItemRendererFactory class implements IDataProviderItemRendererMapper and creats the itemRenderers for each series in a chart. The itemRenderer class is identified on each series either through a property or through a CSS style. Once all of the itemRenderers are created, an itemsCreated event is dispatched causing the layout associated with the chart to size and position the items.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.ChartSelectableItemRendererBead
classes.description: The ChartSelectableItemRendererBead class implements the ISelectableItemRenderer interface and just stores the state. Subclasses will draw.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.ChartView
classes.description: The ChartView class provides the visual elemental structure for a chart. This includes the axis areas and the chart data area where the graphs are drawn.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.DataItemRendererFactoryForSeriesArrayListData
classes.description: The DataItemRendererFactoryForSeriesData creates the itemRenderers necessary for series-based charts.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.DataItemRendererFactoryForSeriesData
classes.description: The DataItemRendererFactoryForSeriesData creates the itemRenderers necessary for series-based charts.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.DataTipBead
classes.description: The DataTipBead can be added to a chart to produce a helpful tip when the moves over an itemRenderer.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.HorizontalCategoryAxisBead
classes.description: The HorizontalCategoryAxisBead displays a horizontal axis with tick marks corresponding to data points identified by the categoryField property. This type of axis is useful for non-numeric plots.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.HorizontalCategoryAxisForArrayListBead
classes.description: The HorizontalCategoryAxisForArrayListBead displays a horizontal axis with tick marks corresponding to data points identified by the categoryField property. This type of axis is useful for non-numeric plots.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.HorizontalLinearAxisBead
classes.description: The HorizontalLinearAxisBead class provides a horizontal axis that uses a numeric range.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.HorizontalLinearAxisForArrayListBead
classes.description: The HorizontalLinearAxisForArrayListBead class provides a horizontal axis that uses a numeric range.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.VerticalCategoryAxisBead
classes.description: The VerticalCategoryAxisBead displays a vertical axis with tick marks corresponding to data points identified by the categoryField property. This type of axis is useful for non-numeric plots.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.VerticalCategoryAxisForArrayListBead
classes.description: The VerticalCategoryAxisForArrayListBead displays a vertical axis with tick marks corresponding to data points identified by the categoryField property. This type of axis is useful for non-numeric plots.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.VerticalLinearAxisBead
classes.description: The VerticalLinearAxisBead class provides a vertical axis that uses a numeric range.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.VerticalLinearAxisForArrayListBead
classes.description: The VerticalLinearAxisBead class provides a vertical axis that uses a numeric range.

classes.description: The BarChartLayout class calculates the size and position of all of the itemRenderers for all of the series in a BarChart.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.layouts.BarChartLayoutForArrayList
classes.description: The BarChartLayoutForArrayList class calculates the size and position of all of the itemRenderers for all of the series in a BarChart.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.layouts.ColumnChartLayout
classes.description: The ColumnChartLayout arranges the graphics in vertical columns (or whatever shape the renderer uses) using a category axis horizontally and a linear axis vertically.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.layouts.ColumnChartLayoutForArrayList
classes.description: The ColumnChartLayoutForArrayList class calculates the size and position of all of the itemRenderers for all of the series in a BarChart.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.layouts.LineChartCategoryVsLinearLayout
classes.description: The LineChartCategoryVsLinearLayout displays a line graph of plot points where the horizontal axis is category value and the vertical axis is numeric.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.layouts.LineChartLinearVsLinearLayout
classes.description: The LineChartLinearVsLinearLayout displays a line graph of plot points where both axes are numeric values.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.layouts.PieChartLayoutForArrayList
classes.description: The PieChartLayoutForArrayList class calculates the size and position of all of the itemRenderers for a PieChart.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.layouts.StackedBarChartLayout
classes.description: The StackedBarChartLayout class calculates the size and position of all of the itemRenderers for all of the series in a StackedBarChart.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.layouts.StackedBarChartLayoutForArrayList
classes.description: The StackedBarChartLayoutForArrayList class calculates the size and position of all of the itemRenderers for all of the series in a BarChart.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.layouts.StackedColumnChartLayout
classes.description: The StackedColumnChartLayout class calculates the size and position of all of the itemRenderers for all of the series in a StackedColumnChart.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.layouts.StackedColumnChartLayoutForArrayList
classes.description: The StackedColumnChartLayoutForArrayList class calculates the size and position of all of the itemRenderers for all of the series in a BarChart.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.models.ChartArrayListSelectionModel
classes.description: The ArraySelectionModel class is a selection model for a dataProvider that is an array. It assumes that items can be fetched from the dataProvider dataProvider[index].  Other selection models would support other kinds of data providers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.beads.models.ChartArraySelectionModel
classes.description: The ArraySelectionModel class is a selection model for a dataProvider that is an array. It assumes that items can be fetched from the dataProvider dataProvider[index].  Other selection models would support other kinds of data providers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.core.CartesianChart
classes.description: This class provides the basis for standard X-Y plots and anything the requires a two-dimensional function graph.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.core.ChartBase
classes.description: The ChartBase class contains all of the properties common to most charts. Some charts may not make any or full use of the properties however.  A chart is based on List which provides data and item renderers to draw the chart graphics. Charts are essentially lists with a different visualization.  Similar to a List, the chart's layout provides the structure of chart while the itemRenderers take care of the actual drawing.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.core.IAxisGroup
classes.description: The IAxisGroup defines the interface for classes that provide drawing space for chart axis objects, such as tick marks and lines.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.core.ICartesianChartLayout
classes.description: This interface is implemented by any Cartesian-style chart layout bead.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.core.IChart
classes.description: The IChart interface is the basic interface for every chart component. All charts have a least one "series" - a collection of data values for each axis of the chart (a PieChart follows this pattern, too, since the total number of items in its series represents 100% of the pie and each item contributes some percentage). A Chart then uses a set of beads particular to that chart type.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.core.IChartDataGroup
classes.description: The IChartDataGroup is the interface for the parent element of chart itemRenderers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.core.IChartDataModel
classes.description: The IChartDataModel provides extensions to the standard ISelectionModel to include the series selected (or rolled over).

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.core.IChartItemRenderer
classes.description: The IChartItemRenderer interface is the interface implemented by any class that draws chart graphics.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.core.IChartSeries
classes.description: The IChartSeries interface is the basic interface for any type of chart data series.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.core.IConnectedItemRenderer
classes.description: The IConnectedItemRenderer interface is the interface used to connect data points on a chart. This interface adds a connection point, (x2,y2), to the (x,y) already supplied by IChartItemRenderer.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.core.IHorizontalAxisBead
classes.description: The IHorizontalAxisBead interface is a marker for any class that draws a horizontal axis. The XAxisBead is an example that implements this interface.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.core.IVerticalAxisBead
classes.description: The IHorizontalAxisBead interface is a marker for any class that draws a verical axis. The YAxisBead is an example that implements this interface.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.core.PolarChart
classes.description: This class provides the basis for circular, or polar, charts. These types of charts, which include PieCharts, may be zero or more radial axes (or 'radii').

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.optimized.SVGBoxItemRenderer
classes.description: The SVGBoxItemRenderer draws its graphics directly into a SVGChartDataGroup (CompoundGraphic).

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.optimized.SVGChartAxisGroup
classes.description: The SVGChartAxisGroup provides a CompoundGraphic whose drawing functions can be used to display a chart's axis graphics without resorting to the creation of extra objects.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.optimized.SVGChartDataGroup
classes.description: The SVGChartDataGroup serves as the drawing canvas for SVG itemRenderers. Rather than having individual itemRenderer objects in the display list, this class provides a canvas where the itemRenderers can draw directly using the flex.core.graphics package.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.charts.optimized.SVGLineSegmentItemRenderer
classes.description: The SVGLineSegmentItemRenderer draws its graphics directly into a SVGChartDataGroup (a CompoundGraphic).

classes.name: org.apache.royale.collections.HierarchicalData

classes.name: org.apache.royale.collections.IArrayList
classes.description: The ArrayList class provides an event-driven wrapper for the standard Array. Events are dispatched when items are added, removed, or changed.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.collections.ICollection

classes.name: org.apache.royale.collections.IHierarchicalData
classes.description: The IHierarchicalData interface defines the interface used to represent hierarchical data as the data provider for a Royale component. Hierarchical data is data in a structure of parent and child data items.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.collections.ISort
classes.description: The ISort interface defines the interface for classes that provide the sorting information required to sort the data of a collection view.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.collections.ISortField
classes.description: The ISortField interface defines the interface for classes that are used with ISort classes, to provide the sorting information required to sort the specific fields or property in a collection view.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.collections.IStringCollection

classes.name: org.apache.royale.collections.ITreeData
classes.description: The ITreeData interface is the basic interface for determining which items in a hierarchical collection should be displayed in the tree.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.collections.LazyCollection
classes.description: The LazyCollection class implements a collection whose items require conversion from a source data format to some other data type.  For example, converting SOAP or JSON to ActionScript data classes. The Flex SDK used to convert all of the data items when the source data arrived, which, for very large data sets or complex data classes, could lock up the user interface. The lazy collection converts items as they are fetched from the collection, resulting in significant performance savings in many cases.  Note that, if you need to compute a summary of data in the collection when the source data arrives, the computation can still lock up the user interface as you will have to visit and convert every data item.  Of course, it is possible to compute that summary in a worker or pseudo-thread. The LazyCollection class is designed to be a bead that attaches to a data retrieval strand that dispatches an Event.COMPLETE and has a "data" property that gets passed to the input parser.  This LazyCollection does not support adding/removing items from the collection or sending data back to the source.  Subclasses have that additional functionality.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.collections.Sort
org.apache.royale.collections.SortField
org.apache.royale.collections.SortFieldCompareTypes
org.apache.royale.collections.TreeData

classes.name: org.apache.royale.collections.converters.IItemConverter
classes.description: The IItemConverter interface is the basic interface for converting a serialized data item to a data class instance.  This interface is generally used in a LazyCollection.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.collections.converters.JSONItemConverter
classes.description: The JSONItemConverter class parses a JSON structure into an ActionScript object.  Other variants would return a specific data class instance.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.collections.parsers.IInputParser
classes.description: The IInputParser interface is the basic interface for parsing data from a server or database into an array of items.  This interface is generally used in a LazyCollection.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.collections.parsers.JSONInputParser
classes.description: The JSONInputParser class parses a JSON structure into an array of JSON sub-structures.  It assumes the input JSON format is an array without sub-arrays. A more complex parser might be needed for more complex JSON structures.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.cordova.Application

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.AirApplication

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.AllCSSStyles
classes.description: The AllCSSStyles class contains all CSS style supported in HTML. It is not advisable to use this class in production code because it will unnecessarily inflate your code size. Rather, you should copy the class and trim it down in your app to the specific styles you use.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.AllCSSValuesImpl
classes.description: The AllCSSValuesImpl class will eventually implement a full set of CSS lookup rules.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.Application
classes.description: The Application class is the main class and entry point for a Royale application.  This Application class is different than the Flex SDK's mx:Application or spark:Application in that it does not contain user interface elements.  Those UI elements go in the views (ViewBase).  This Application class expects there to be a main model, a controller, and an initial view.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ApplicationBase
classes.description: This is a platform-dependent base class for Application

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ApplicationFactory
classes.description: This is a platform-dependent base class for Application

classes.description: Base class for simple beads

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.BeadViewBase
classes.description: The BeadViewBase class is the base class for most view beads.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.BindableCSSStyles
classes.description: The BindableCSSStyles class contains CSS style properties supported by SimpleCSSValuesImpl but dispatch change events when modified  The class implements IStyleObject which means the host object sets a reference onto this one, allowing us to reapply the styles to the host component when the style is changed.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.BindableCSSStylesWithFlex

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.BrowserOrientation
classes.description: The BrowserOrientation class listens for browser resizing (only in devices) and dispatchh orientation change events. - if orientation is portratit it dispatches: 'orientationPortrait' - if orientation is ladspace it dispatches: 'orientationLandscape'

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.BrowserResizeApplicationListener
classes.description: The BrowserResizeApplicationListener class listens for browser resizing and resizes the application accordingly.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.BrowserResizeListener

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.CSSShape

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.CSSSprite

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.CallLaterBead

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ClassFactory

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ConstraintSize
