classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ContainerBase
classes.description: The ContainerBase class is the base class for most containers in Royale.  It is usable as the root tag of MXML documents and UI controls and containers are added to it.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ContainerBaseStrandChildren
classes.description: The ContainerBaseStrandChildren class the provides a way for advanced components to place children directly into the strand unlike the addElement() APIs on the Container which place children into the contentView.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.DataContainerBase
classes.description: The DataContainerBase class is the base class for components that that have generated content, like lists.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.DispatcherBead
classes.description: Base class for beads which need to dispatch events

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.DropType
classes.description: The DropType class provides a set of constant values of types of drops in a drag/drop operation

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.EventLoggingBead
classes.description: The EventLogging bead logs dispatches of certain events.  This can be useful in debugging type coercion errors when an event handler has the wrong type in the function signature.  Place this bead in the application.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.FilledRectangle
classes.description: The FilledRectangle class draws a simple filled rectangle without a border and with square corners.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.FormatBase
classes.description: The FormatBase class serves as a base class for custom formatters. It cannot be used as a base for an MXML document.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.GroupBase
classes.description: The GroupBase class is the base class for most simple containers in Royale.  It is usable as the root tag of MXML documents and UI controls and containers are added to it.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IAlertModel
classes.description: The IAlertModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to an Alert control.  More sophisticated Alert controls could have models that extend IAlertModel.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IApplicationView
classes.description: The IApplicationView interface is the  interface for main view of the application.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IBead
classes.description: The IBead interface is the basic interface for plug-ins known as Beads. In Royale, the recommended pattern is to break out optional functionality into small plug-ins that can be re-used in other components, or replaced with different implementations optimized for different things such as size, performance, advanced features, debugging, etc.  Beads are told what host component or "strand" they ae attached to.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController
classes.description: The IBeadController interface is a "marker" interface for beads that are controllers.  A marker interface has no addtional APIs. It is used to find the controller on the strand via calls to getBeadByType.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IBeadKeyController
classes.description: The IBeadKeyController interface is a "marker" interface for beads that are key controllers. Key controllers add keyboard support to the strand. A marker interface has no addtional APIs. It is used to find the controller on the strand via calls to getBeadByType.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IBeadLayout
classes.description: The IBeadLayout interface is a "marker" interface for beads that manage the layout for a control.  A marker interface has no addtional APIs. It is used to find the layout bead on the strand via calls to getBeadByType.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel
classes.description: The IBeadModel interface is a "marker" interface for beads that represent the data model for a control.  A marker interface has no addtional APIs. It is used to find the model bead on the strand via calls to getBeadByType.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IBeadTransform
classes.description: The IBeadTransform interface is the basic interface for the container views that transform drawable objects that implement ITransformHost

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView
classes.description: The IBeadView interface is the interface for beads that represent the view for a control. It is used to find the view bead on the strand via calls to getBeadByType.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IBinaryImage
classes.description: The IBinaryImage interface describes the minimum set of properties available to an Image control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IBinaryImageLoader
classes.description: The IBinaryImageLoader interface marks classes that are used for loading binary data to image views

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IBinaryImageModel
classes.description: The IImageModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to an Image control.  More sophisticated Image controls could have models that extend IImageModel.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IBinding
classes.description: IBinding interface is a "marker" for data-binding class that is optimized for simple assignments of one object's property to another object's property.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IBorderModel
classes.description: The IBorderModel interface is the basic interface for a data model for drawing borders.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IBorderPaddingMarginValuesImpl
classes.description: The IBorderPaddingMarginValuesImpl abstracts how to get data on the border, padding and margin of a component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ICSSImpl
classes.description: A marker interface so the compiler knows whether to emit CSS

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ICascadingMenuModel
classes.description: The ITextModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to control that displays text.  More sophisticated controls often have models that extend ITextModel.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IChangePropagator
classes.description: The IChangePropagator is a marker interface

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IChild
classes.description: The IChild interface is the basic interface for a component that is parented by another component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IChrome
classes.description: The IChrome interface is a "marker" interface. Items that implement IChrome are designating themselves as being attached to their parent in a way that's different from normal content. For example, to a Container, a child being added that's an IChrome implementor will be added outside of the content area.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IColorModel
classes.description: The IColorModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to a control that displays or edits color.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IColorSpectrumModel
classes.description: The IColorSpectrumModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to a control that displays a color spectrum

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IColorWithAlphaModel
classes.description: The IColorModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to a control that displays or edits color.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IColumns
classes.description: The IColumns interface describes the minimum set of properties available for a component that uses columns. Examples of components are DataGrids and Tables.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IComboBoxModel
classes.description: The IComboBoxModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to a ComboBox control.  More sophisticated ComboBox controls could have models that extend IComboBoxModel.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IContainer
classes.description: The IContainer interface is used to mark certain components as Containers. While most components are containers in the sense that they are composited from a set of child components, the term Container is commonly used in Flex to denote components that take an arbitrary set or sets of children and do not try to abstract away that fact.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IContainerBaseStrandChildrenHost
classes.description: The IContainerBaseStrandChildrenHost interface is implemented by components that use a ContainerBaseStrandChildren to proxy addElement/removeElement calls to an internal child and has the following APIs so the View can set up the "chrome" around the internal child.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IContainerView
classes.description: The IContainerView interface should be implemented by any view bead that acts as the primary view for a ContainerBase-derived class.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IContentViewHost
classes.description: This interface is implemented by components that provide access to "behind the scenes" children that are not accessible through the addElement()/removeElement() APIs.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IDataGrid
classes.description: The IDataGrid interface is implemented by any component that supports being a "DataGrid" which means its content is generated by a factory and whose children are item renderers (IItemRenderer).

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IDataGridModel
classes.description: The IDataGridModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to an DataGrid control.  More sophisticated DataGrid controls could have models that extend IDataGridModel.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IDataGridPresentationModel
classes.description: The IDataGridPresentationModel interfaces defines the data needed to present a DataGrid.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IDataProviderItemRendererMapper
classes.description: The IDataProviderItemRendererMapper interface is the interface for beads that know how to iterate through a dataProvider, generate item renderers, and assign items from the dataProvider to those item renderers.  In Royale, a wide range of data providers are allowed, from simple Arrays and Vectors on up to sophisticated data structures that dispatch change events. Different IDataProviderItemRendererMapper implements are often required to iterate through those different data structures.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IDataProviderModel
classes.description: The IDataProviderModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to control that let the user choose within a set of items in a dataProvider.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IDataProviderNotifier
classes.description: The IDataProviderNotifier interface is a "marker" interface for beads that manage that dispatch events when data providers change.  A marker interface has no addtional APIs. It is used to find the notifier bead on the strand via calls to getBeadByType.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IDataProviderVirtualItemRendererMapper
classes.description: The IDataProviderItemRendererMapper interface is the interface for beads that know how to iterate through a dataProvider, generate item renderers, and assign items from the dataProvider to those item renderers.  In Royale, a wide range of data providers are allowed, from simple Arrays and Vectors on up to sophisticated data structures that dispatch change events. Different IDataProviderItemRendererMapper implements are often required to iterate through those different data structures.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IDateChooserModel
classes.description: The IDateChooserModel interface.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IDateChooserModelWithChangeCheck
classes.description: The IDateChooserModelWithChangeCheck adds a disabledChangeCheck API to the IDateChooserModel interface.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IDateControlConfigBead
classes.description: The IDateControlConfigBead interface should be implemented by any bead that provides a locale configuration for date controls like DateField and DateChooser

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IDateFormatter
classes.description: The IDateFormatter interface should be implemented by any bead that provides formatting of a date.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IDocument
classes.description: The IDocument interface is the basic interface for objects that can be tags in an MXML document and need to know about the host document.  It is similar to the IMXMLObject interface in the Flex SDK.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IDragInitiator
classes.description: The IDragInitiator interface is the basic interface for the object that wants to know if a drop was accepted in a drag/drop operation.  There are two methods instead of the usual one because in some scenarios the drag initiator needs to prepare the data before it gets dropped. For example, in a tree control, dragging from one node to another, the tree should un-parent the node before it is moved to the new parent node, so the tree would un-parent the node in acceptingDrop.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IEffectTimer
classes.description: The IEffectTimer interface is the basic interface for the class that updates effects like tweens.  Different IEffectTimer implementations are tuned for various runtime environments like mobile, Flash, desktop, or even automated testing where the currentTime is controlled so the animation updates its target at predictable positions on the screen.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IFactory
classes.description: The IFactory interface is the basic interface used as the type for properties that specify a factory for item renderers and other scenarios where multiple copies of a custom class are generated.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IFlexInfo
classes.description: The IFlexInfo interface is an interface used to signal to the compiler that it should generate a data structure that contains information about the application such as its size, mixins, locale, etc.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IFocusable
classes.description: The IFocusable interface should be implemented by any component that can get the focus

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IFormatter
classes.description: The IFormatter interface should be implemented by any bead that provides a formatting service.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IHasImage
classes.description: The IHasImage interface describes the minimum set of properties available to a component with an image.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IIcon
classes.description: IIcon interface provides abstraction for easiest way to implements custom icon class

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IIconSupport
classes.description: Implement if a class will need ability to display an icon

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IId
classes.description: The IId interface is the basic interface for components that must have an id or identifier for a concrete instance.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IImage
classes.description: The IBinaryImage interface describes the minimum set of properties available to an Image control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IImageButton
classes.description: The IImageButton interface describes the minimum set of properties available to an ImageButton control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IImageModel
classes.description: The IImageModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to an Image control.  More sophisticated Image controls could have models that extend IImageModel.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IImageView
classes.description: The IImageView interface is the interface for beads that represent image views. It is used to find the view bead on the strand via calls to getBeadByType.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IIndexedItemRenderer
classes.description: The IIndexedItemRenderer interface is the basic interface for item renderers that have an index property that indicates its index in the list of renderers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IIndexedItemRendererInitializer
classes.description: The IIndexedItemRendererInitializer interface is the basic interface for beads that initialize properties on an IItemRenderer.  Simple implementations only assign the data and itemRendererOwnerView property, but others will assign other properties if needed.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IInitialViewApplication
classes.description: The IInitialViewApplication interface is the interface for applications with a single initial views.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IItemRenderer
classes.description: The IItemRenderer interface is the basic interface for item renderers. More complex item renderers may implements extensions of this interface.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IItemRendererClassFactory
classes.description: The IItemRendererClassFactory interface is the basic interface for beads that generate instances of IItemRenderers.  Note that this is not the same as an org.apache.royale.core.IFactory which is a lower-level interface for generating an instance of just about anything.  IItemRendererClassFactory implementations often use IFactory to generate the actual item renderer instance, but the IItemRendererClassFactory bead allows for more computation about which renderer to instantiate. For example, the default implementation in org.apache.royale.core.ItemRendererClassFactory checks for an itemRenderer property on the strand, then looks for a default definition in CSS, but also handles the renderer being defined in MXML in sub tags of the ItemRendererClassFactory.  Other more advanced implementations could return different renderers based on the data item's type.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IItemRendererInitializer
classes.description: The IItemRendererInitializer interface is the basic interface for beads that initialize properties on an IItemRenderer.  Simple implementations only assign the itemRendererOwnerView property, but others will assign other properties if needed.  The implementations do not assign the data property.  The Factory/Mapper will assign data as the last property, after parenting, in order to trigger any data-bindings once.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IItemRendererOwnerView
classes.description: The IItemRendererOwnerView interface is the basic interface for the container that parents item renderers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IItemRendererProvider
classes.description: The IItemRendererProvider interface is implemented by classes that provide a ClassFactory for itemRenderers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ILabelFieldItemRenderer
classes.description: The IIndexedItemRenderer interface is the basic interface for item renderers that have an index property that indicates its index in the list of renderers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ILabelFunction
classes.description: The ILabelFunction interface is the interface used at Item Renderer level to detect if there's a bead on the strand that wants to use an external label function to format labels.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ILayoutChild
classes.description: The IChild interface is the basic interface for a component that is parented by another component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ILayoutHost
classes.description: The ILayoutHost interface is the basic interface for the container views that have an IBeadLayout.  The layout implementation often needs to know certain things about other objects in the view.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ILayoutParent
classes.description: The ILayoutParent interface is implemented by those components that allow their children to be manipulated by a layout.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ILayoutView
classes.description: The ILayoutView interface is implemented by any component that has ILayoutChild children.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IList
classes.description: The IList interface is implemented by any component that supports being a "list" which means its content is generated by a factory and whose children are item renderers (IItemRenderer).

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IListDataItemRenderer
classes.description: The IItemRenderer interface is the basic interface for item renderers. More complex item renderers may implements extensions of this interface.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IListPresentationModel
classes.description: The IListPresentationModel interface holds key values for the display of lists.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IListWithPresentationModel
classes.description: The IListWithPresentationModel interface is implemented by any IList that supports a separate IListPresentationModel

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ILocalizedValuesImpl
classes.description: The ILocalizedValuesImpl interface is the basic interface for the subsystem that provides localized values to components.  In Royale, different interfaces and implementations will handle different aspects of localization.  For example, implementations of this interface returns strings and possibly other values stored in the application, whereas a different interface will tackle date formatting, yet another may take on date parsing, because, per the pay-as-you-go (PAYG) principle, applications don't need to carry every localization feature if they don't need them.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IMXMLDocument
classes.description: The IMXMLDocument interface is an interface for a component that supports being written in MXML.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IMeasurementBead
classes.description: The IMeasurementBead interface is the basic interface for the bead that can compute and report the measurements of the contents of a component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IMenuBarModel
classes.description: The IComboBoxModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to a ComboBox control.  More sophisticated ComboBox controls could have models that extend IComboBoxModel.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IMenuModel
classes.description: The IMenuModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available for a Menu.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IModule
classes.description: The compiler checks the main class to see if it implements the IModule interface and generates bootstrapping code for a module instead of an application.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IMultiSelectionModel
classes.description: The IMultiSelectionModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to control that let the user select one or more items from within a set of items in a dataProvider.  A more sophisticated model would support multiple selection.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IOwnerViewItemRenderer
classes.description: The IOwnerViewItemRenderer interface is the basic interface for item renderers that have an itemRendererOwnerView property that references the View of the component that eventually parents the item renderers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IPanelModel
classes.description: The IPanelModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to a Panel control.  More sophisticated Panel controls could have models that extend IPanelModel.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IParent
classes.description: The IParent interface is the basic interface for a component that contains subcomponents, including the application class.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IParentIUIBase
classes.description: The IParentIUIBase interface is a convenience interface for IUIBase components that contains subcomponents.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IPopUp
classes.description: The IPopUp interface is a "marker" interface for a component that should be floated above other components that aren't an IPopUp.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IPopUpHost
classes.description: The IPopUpHost interface is a "marker" interface for a component that parents components that implement IPopUp.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IPopUpHostParent
classes.description: The IPopUpHostParent is the effective parent of popups. The actual parent may not be the effective parent in some implementations, so the effective parent provides a reference back to the IPopUpHost for removing

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IRangeModel
classes.description: The IRangeModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to control that let the user select from within a range of numbers like NumericStepper and Slider.  More sophisticated controls could have models that extend IRangeModel.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IRemovableBead
classes.description: The IRemovableBead interface is an interface for beads that need to do some work before beign removed from the strand calling tearDown method like clean listeners.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IRenderedObject
classes.description: The IRenderedObject interface is the basic interface for a component that has been rendered.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IRollOverModel
classes.description: The IRollOverModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to control that supports rollover highlighting of an item within a set of items.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IRuntimeSelectableItemRenderer
classes.description: The IItemRenderer interface is the basic interface for item renderers. More complex item renderers may implements extensions of this interface.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ISWFApplication
classes.description: Interface for bootstrapping SWF Applications.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IScrollBarModel
classes.description: The IScrollBarModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to control that let the user select from within a range of numbers like ScrollBar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IScrollingLayoutParent
classes.description: The IScrollingLayoutParent interface is an ILayoutParent that has traditional scrollbars.  The layout implementation often needs to know certain things about other objects in the component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IScrollingViewport
classes.description: A ScrollingViewport is a Viewport that scrolls overflow content.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ISelectable
classes.description: The ISelectable interface is a marker interface for indicating a class has a selected property.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ISelectableItemRenderer
classes.description: The IItemRenderer interface is the basic interface for item renderers that require selection.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ISelectionModel
classes.description: The ISelectionModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to control that let the user select from within a set of items in a dataProvider.  A more sophisticated model would support multiple selection.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IState
classes.description: The IState interface is a basic interface for States that are handled by various IStatesImpls.  IStatesImpls watche for the currentState property to change and executes changes accordingly.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IStatesImpl
classes.description: The IStatesImpl interface is a "marker" interface for the implementation view states in a View like ViewBase.  The implementation watches for the currentState property to change and executes changes accordingly.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IStatesObject
classes.description: The IStatesObject interface is the interface for an object that supports states.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IStrand
classes.description: The IStrand interface is the basic interface for a host component for a set of plug-ins known as Beads. In Royale, the recommended pattern is to break out optional functionality into small plug-ins that can be re-used in other components, or replaced with different implementations optimized for different things such as size, performance, advanced features, debugging, etc.  Beads are added to and removed from a Strand and can find and coordinate with other beads on the strand.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IStrandWithModel
classes.description: The IStrand interface is the basic interface for a host component for a set of plug-ins known as Beads. In Royale, the recommended pattern is to break out optional functionality into small plug-ins that can be re-used in other components, or replaced with different implementations optimized for different things such as size, performance, advanced features, debugging, etc.  Beads are added to and removed from a Strand and can find and coordinate with other beads on the strand.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IStrandWithModelView
classes.description: The IStrandWithModelView interface is the basic interface for a host component for a set of plug-ins known as Beads where two of the plugins are a model and a view. In Royale, the recommended pattern is to break out optional functionality into small plug-ins that can be re-used in other components, or replaced with different implementations optimized for different things such as size, performance, advanced features, debugging, etc.  Beads are added to and removed from a Strand and can find and coordinate with other beads on the strand.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IStrandWithPresentationModel
classes.description: The IStrandWithPresentationModel interface is implemented by any IStrand that supports a separate bead that is a presentationModel.  A presentationModel is a set of properties that act as parameters to the View as opposed to the regular model that is the data to be displayed by the view.  A simple example is the rowHeight of a vertical list.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IStyleObject
classes.description: The IStyleObject interface is the interface for objects that contain style properties.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IStyleableObject
classes.description: The IStyleableObject interface is the interface for objects that support style properties.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IStyledUIBase
classes.description: The IStyledUIBase interface is the interface for advanced user interface components. Used in StyledUIBase that is the core component in the Jewel UI Set

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ITableModel
classes.description: The IDataGridModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to an DataGrid control.  More sophisticated DataGrid controls could have models that extend IDataGridModel.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ITextButton
classes.description: ITextButton interface is implemented by button classes with text property like Button, CheckBox and RadioButton

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ITextInput
classes.description: The IContainer interface is used to mark certain components as Containers. While most components are containers in the sense that they are composited from a set of child components, the term Container is commonly used in Flex to denote components that take an arbitrary set or sets of children and do not try to abstract away that fact.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ITextModel
classes.description: The ITextModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to control that displays text.  More sophisticated controls often have models that extend ITextModel.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ITitleBarModel
classes.description: The ITitleBarModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to control that displays a title bar.  More sophisticated controls often have models that extend ITitleBarModel.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IToggleButtonModel
classes.description: The IToggleButtonModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available to ToggleButton that displays a text label.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IToolTipBead
classes.description: The IToolTipBead interface for tooltip implementations.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ITransformHost
classes.description: The ITransformHost interface is the basic interface for the container views that have an IBeadTransform.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ITransformModel
classes.description: The ITransformModel interface describes the minimum set of properties needed to define a transformation on an object.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IUIBase
classes.description: The IUIBase interface is the basic interface for user interface components.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IValueToggleButtonModel
classes.description: The IValueToggleButtonModel interface describes the minimum set of properties available each ToggleButton in a group of ToggleButtons of which only one can be selected at a time.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IValuesImpl
classes.description: The IValuesImpl interface is the basic interface for the subsystem that provides default values to components.  The most common implementation implements a simple version of CSS and uses data structures compiled from CSS files.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IViewport
classes.description: A Viewport is a window onto an area of content. A viewport is given space in which to operate by a View bead. Viewports can control their area which is specified by the IViewportModel, adding scrollbars or whatever scrolling mechanism they want.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IViewportModel
classes.description: A Viewport is the area of a Container set aside for displaying content and any scrolling controls. The ViewportModel caches the offsets required to compute the size of the Viewport.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.IViewportScroller
classes.description: The IViewportScroller interface describes an object that can be used to scroll or navigate around a system that uses an IViewport. This may be a traditional scroll bar, or it could be something completely different.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ImageBase
classes.description: The ImageBase class serves as a base class for components that displays a bitmap. The Image uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the Image, including the url/binary property. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView: constructs the visual elements of the component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ImageViewBase
classes.description: The ImageView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.html.Image component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ItemRendererClassFactory
classes.description: The ItemRendererClassFactory class is the default implementation of IItemRendererClassFactory.  This implementation checks for an itemRenderer property on the strand, then looks for a default definition in CSS, but also handles the renderer being defined in MXML in sub tags of the ItemRendererClassFactory.  Other more advanced implementations could return different renderers based on the data item's type.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ItemRendererOwnerViewBead
classes.description: The ItemRendererOwnerViewBead stores a reference to the IItemRendererOwnerView for an IItemRenderer

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.LayoutBase
classes.description: This class is the base class for most, if not all, layouts.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.LayoutManager
classes.description: The LayoutManager class is an all static class which allows queing up measuring of components and layouts to prevent layout thrashing

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ListBaseStrandChildren
classes.description: The ListBaseStrandChildren exists so that Lists are compatible with the ListView/ContainerView beads.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.Lookalike
classes.description: The UIElement class Takes an IRenderedObject and creates a new UIBase which has the *appearance* of the original object. It *does not* have any of the orginal object's functionality.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.MXMLDragInitiator
classes.description: The MXMLDragInitiator is an IDragInitiator that dispatches events when the IDragInitiator methods are called to make it easier to handle in MXML.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.OverridableSelectableItemRendererClassFactory
classes.description: The SelectableItemRendererClassFactory class extends the default ItemRendererClassFactory and adds an ISelectableItemRenderer Bead to each renderer instance.  That allows renderers to be used in lists with or without selection.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ParentDocumentBead
classes.description: The ParentDocumentBead class looks up the parent chain to find a parent that was written in MXML. Because it is usually rare for an application to need to know this information, an optional bead is used to compute it, instead of baking in the overhead of a recursive infrastucture to store this information.  It is intended to be used as a bead in the top-level tag of an MXML document.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.SelectableItemRendererClassFactory
classes.description: The SelectableItemRendererClassFactory class extends the default ItemRendererClassFactory and adds an ISelectableItemRenderer Bead to each renderer instance.  That allows renderers to be used in lists with or without selection.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.SimpleApplication
classes.description: The SimpleApplication class can be used as the main class and entry point for low-level ActionScript-only Royale applications.  It is not indended for use in MXML applications or most of the Royale components as they expect a certain application lifecycle in the org.apache.royale.core.Application class.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.SimpleCSSStyles
classes.description: The SimpleCSSStyles class contains CSS style properties supported by SimpleCSSValuesImpl.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.SimpleCSSStylesWithFlex
classes.description: The SimpleCSSStyles class contains CSS style properties supported by SimpleCSSValuesImpl.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.SimpleCSSValuesImpl
classes.description: The SimpleCSSValuesImpl class implements a minimal set of CSS lookup rules that is sufficient for most applications and is easily implemented for SWFs. It does not support attribute selectors or descendant selectors or id selectors.  It will filter on a custom -royale-swf media query but not other media queries.  It can be replaced with other implementations that handle more complex selector lookups.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.SimpleLocalizedValuesImpl
classes.description: The SimpleLocalizedValuesImpl class implements a simple getValue implementation that is sufficient for many very simple applications. Every key in every bundle must be provided in every locale.  There is no fall-through logic to the next locale.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.SimpleStatesImpl
classes.description: The SimpleStatesImpl class implements a minimal set of view state functionality that is sufficient for most applications. It only supports AddItems and SetProperty changes at this time.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.SimpleValuesImpl
classes.description: The SimpleValuesImpl class implements a simple lookup rules that is sufficient for many very simple applications.  Every value is essential global and shared by other instances.  Values are set via calls to setValue.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.StageProxy
classes.description: The StageProxy class wraps the stage and presents it as a Royale IEventDispatcher.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.StatesWithTransitionsImpl
classes.description: The StatesWithTransitionsImpl class implements a set of view state functionality that includes transitions between states. It only supports AddItems and SetProperty and SetEventHandler changes at this time.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.Strand
classes.description: The Strand class is the base class for non-display object that implement a strand.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.StrandWithModel
classes.description: The Strand class is the base class for non-display object that implement a strand.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.StyleChangeNotifier
classes.description: The StyleChangeNotifier can be added to the bead list of any UI component that needs to react to dynamic changes to its styles.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.StyleableCSSTextField
classes.description: The StyleableCSSTextField class implements more CSS text styles in a TextField. This makes it easier to use one in a "shadow DOM" in a complex skin.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.StyledMXMLItemRenderer
classes.description: The StyledMXMLItemRenderer class is the base class for itemRenderers that are MXML-based and provides support for ClassSelectorList.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.StyledUIBase
classes.description: The StyledUIBase is the base class for UIBase components that makes heavy use of styles through IClassSelectorListSupport, and supports emphasis property through IEmphasis.  For Javascript platform it allows to default size properties (like width and height) to broswer defaults by removing the property. This is done through NaN value (that is the default)

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.TextLineMetrics
classes.description: The TextLineMetrics class contains font information about a line of text

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.UIBase
classes.description: The UIBase class is the base class for most composite user interface components.  For the Flash Player, Buttons and Text controls may have a different base class and therefore may not extend UIBase. However all user interface components should implement IUIBase.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.UIButtonBase
classes.description: The UIButtonBase class is the base class for most Buttons in a Royale application.  In Flash, these buttons extend SimpleButton and therefore do not support all of the Sprite APIs.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.UIHTMLElementWrapper
classes.description: The UIHTMLElementWrapper class is the base class for most Buttons and other UI objects in a Royale application that do not have children. In Flash, these buttons extend SimpleButton and therefore do not support all of the Sprite APIs.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ValuesManager
classes.description: The ValuesManager class is one of the few Singleton classes in Royale.  Instances of other things can be shared via IValuesImpl, but this class's API is its one static property where you get the instance of IValuesImpl by which other instances can be shared.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.View
classes.description: The View class is the class for most views in a Royale application.  It is generally used as the root tag of MXML documents and UI controls and containers are added to it.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.ViewBase
classes.description: The ViewBase class is the base class for most views in a Royale application.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.layout.EdgeData
classes.description: The EdgeData class is a utility class for holding four border and or padding of a component.  We don't use a Rectangle because Rectangle likes wants a width instead of a right value.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.layout.ILayoutChildren
classes.description: The ILayoutChildren interface is a configurator marker bead that indicate to layout classes (i.e: StyledLayoutBase) that child instances must refresh layout due to changes in size.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.layout.ILayoutStyleProperties
classes.description: The ILayoutStyleProperties interface is the contract for layout beads that needs to retrieve style properties set in their host component and apply to itself.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.layout.IPaddings
classes.description: The Paddings class is a bead that adds padding to its host

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.layout.LayoutData
classes.description: The LayoutData class is a utility class for holding margins, border and padding of a component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.layout.MarginData
classes.description: The MarginData class is a utility class for holding four margins of a component, plus a flag for if both left and right margin have been set to "auto".

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.styles.BorderStyles
classes.description: The BorderStyles class is a utility class for getting the 3 main border styles (width, color, style)

classes.name: org.apache.royale.core.supportClasses.StyledImageBase
classes.description: The StyledImageBase class serves as a base class for components that displays a bitmap and used ClassSelectorList for set class selector names The Image uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the Image, including the url/binary property. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView: constructs the visual elements of the component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.createjs.Application
classes.description: The Application class is the main class and entry point for a Royale application.  This Application class is different than the Flex SDK's mx:Application or spark:Application in that it does not contain user interface elements.  Those UI elements go in the views (ViewBase).  This Application class expects there to be a main model, a controller, and an initial view.  This is the CreateJS Application class which must be used in place of the normal Royale Application. CreateJS uses the HTML5 <canvas>, rather than the HTML DOM. This class sets up the canvas and injects the necessary script elements into the index.html file to bootstrap CreateJS.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.createjs.Container
classes.description: Provides a nestable Container for CreateJS elements.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.createjs.Label
classes.description: The Label class provides a static text string which may be colored.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.createjs.TextButton
classes.description: The TextButton class provides a clickable button.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.createjs.core.CreateJSBase
classes.description: This is the base class for CreateJS component wrappers used by Royale applications. This class provides standard properties that most of the Royale CreateJS wrapper classes use, such as a fill color.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.createjs.core.UIBase
classes.description: The CreateJS framework provides its own version of UIBase. CreateJS uses the HTML 5 <canvas> for its work and does not use the HTML DOM like the most of Royale, so this replacement for UIBase allows the CreateJS wrapper classes for Royale to fit in.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.createjs.core.View
classes.description: This version of View is specific for CreateJS since CreateJS does not use the HTML DOM.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.createjs.graphics.Circle
classes.description: Creates a circle.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.createjs.graphics.GraphicShape
classes.description: This is the base class for CreateJS graphic shape components such as Circle and Rect.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.createjs.graphics.Rect
classes.description: Creates a rectangle.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.createjs.tween.Ease
classes.description: This is the base class for the CreateJS/TweenJS effects.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.createjs.tween.Effect
classes.description: This is the base class for the CreateJS/TweenJS effects.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.createjs.tween.Sequence
classes.description: The Sequence effect plays a set of effects, one after the other.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.createjs.tween.Tween
classes.description: The Tween effect animates an object from one place to another; it can also fade and object in and out by adjusting the object's alpha value. Once the target object is set, its starting position may be given (or its current location will be used) and an ending position given, the play() function is used to make the animation have effect.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.css2.Cursors
classes.description: The Label class implements the basic control for labeling other controls.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.display.CapsStyle
classes.description: These constants will be inlined in javascript

classes.name: org.apache.royale.display.JPEGEncoderOptions
classes.description: This class is not available for reflection

classes.name: org.apache.royale.display.JointStyle
classes.description: These constants will be inlined in javascript

classes.name: org.apache.royale.display.LineScaleMode
classes.description: These constants will be inlined in javascript

classes.name: org.apache.royale.display.PNGEncoderOptions
classes.description: This class is not available for reflection

classes.name: org.apache.royale.effects.CompoundEffect
classes.description: CompoundEffect implements ICompoundEffect by dispatching events that should be handled by pluggable beads.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.effects.Effect
classes.description: Effect is the base class for effects in Royale.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.effects.Fade
classes.description: The Fade effect animates a UI component's alpha or opacity.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.effects.ICompoundEffect
classes.description: ICompoundEffect aggregates several related effects. Implementors will decide on the order in which they're played.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.effects.IEffect
classes.description: IEffect is the lowest-level interface for effects in Royale.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.effects.Move
classes.description: The Move effect animates a UI component's x or y position.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.effects.Parallel
classes.description: The Parallel effect animates set of effects at the same time.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.effects.PlatformWiper
classes.description: Helper class for Wipe effects.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.effects.Resize
classes.description: The Resize effect animates a UI component's width or height.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.effects.Sequence
classes.description: The Sequence effect animates set of effects one after the other.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.effects.Tween
classes.description:
Tween is the underlying animation class for the effects in Royale. The Tween class defines a tween, a property animation performed on a target object over a period of time. That animation can be a change in position, such as performed by the Move effect; a change in size, as performed by the Resize or Zoom effects; a change in visibility, as performed by the Fade or Dissolve effects; or other types of animations.

A Tween instance accepts the startValue, endValue, and duration properties, and an optional easing function to define the animation.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.effects.Wipe
classes.description: The Fade effect animates a UI component's alpha or opacity.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.events.CloseEvent
classes.description: The CloseEvent class represents event objects specific to popup windows, such as the Alert control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.events.CollectionEvent
classes.description: The CollectionEvent class is used for dispatching an collection events

classes.name: org.apache.royale.events.CustomEvent
classes.description: MXML auto-imports flash.events.Event which then requires full qualification to use org.apache.royale.events.Event. Use CustomEvent to skip all that extra typing.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.events.DetailEvent
classes.description: The DetailEvent class is used for dispatching an event that has a string with more information

classes.name: org.apache.royale.events.DragEvent
classes.description: Drag and Drop Events.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.events.DragEventBase
classes.description: Drag and Drop Events.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.events.Event
classes.description: This class simply wraps flash.events.Event so that no flash packages are needed on the JS side. At runtime, this class is not always the event object that is dispatched.  In most cases we are dispatching DOMEvents instead, so as long as you don't actually check the typeof(event) it will work

classes.name: org.apache.royale.events.EventDispatcher
classes.description: This class simply wraps flash.events.EventDispatcher so that no flash packages are needed on the JS side.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.events.FocusEvent
classes.description: An object dispatches a FocusEvent object when the user changes the focus from one object in the display list to another  There are four types of focus events: FocusEvent.FOCUS_IN FocusEvent.FOCUS_OUT FocusEvent.KEY_FOCUS_CHANGE FocusEvent.MOUSE_FOCUS_CHANGE

classes.name: org.apache.royale.events.IEventDispatcher
classes.description: This class simply wraps flash.events.EventDispatcher so that no flash packages are needed on the JS side.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.events.IRoyaleEvent
classes.description: This class simply wraps flash.events.Event so that no flash packages are needed on the JS side. At runtime, this class is not always the event object that is dispatched.  In most cases we are dispatching DOMEvents instead, so as long as you don't actually check the typeof(event) it will work

classes.name: org.apache.royale.events.ItemAddedEvent
classes.description: The ItemAddedEvent is dispatched by IItemRendererOwnerView objects whenenver an itemRenderer is added.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.events.ItemClickedEvent
classes.description: The ItemClickedEvent is a custom event issued by an itemRenderer to convey information about itself when it has determined that the event(s) happening to it constitute a 'click' on itself.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.events.ItemRemovedEvent
classes.description: The ItemRemovedEvent is dispatched by IItemRendererOwnerView objects whenenver an itemRenderer is removed.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.events.ItemRendererEvent
classes.description: The ItemRendererEvent is dispatched by DataItemRendererFactory classes under various conditions.

values: In Royale, the List component requires a data provider source and a class to be used as an itemRenderer to display the data.
In the Royale Express package, data binding is prepackaged into the List component. The Royale Express List also includes support for scrolling as well as drag-and-drop.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.express.NumericStepper
classes.description: The NumericStepper class is a component that displays a numeric value and up/down controls (using a org.apache.royale.html.Spinner) to increase and decrease the value by specific amounts. The NumericStepper uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the component of type org.apache.royale.core.IRangeModel. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView: constructs the parts of the component. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: handles the input events.

See also the Royale Express ImageButton and the Royale Express ImageAndTextButton.

The Royale Express View includes data binding. For convenience, Royale Express also provides HView (horizontal layout) and VView (vertical layout).

classes.name: org.apache.royale.express.beads.layouts.DataGridLayout
classes.description: This DataGridLayout class sizes and positions all of the elements of the DataGrid in the Express package. The ButtonBar header, the container content area for the the list columns, and the positioning and sizing of the list columns within that container. On top of the contain a drawing layer is floating to allow for the graphics of a drag-and-drop indicator.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.express.supportClasses.DataGridColumn
classes.description: This class defines how a column in the DataGrid should look, including the label for the column and its width. In particular, the width may be given as a fixed pixel size (e.g., "80") or a percentage of the remaining space once all fixed-width columns have been taken into consideration (e.g., "100%"). That is, if the DataGrid has a width of 400 pixels with columns of "50", "100%", and "80", the "100%" column is the remainder of 400-50-80 or 260. If the DataGrid is resized to 500 pixels, the outer columns remain at 50 and 80 pixels, but the middle column expands to 360 pixels given its "100%" value.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.file.FileProxy
classes.description: The FileProxy class is where beads regarding file operations are added. Information about operations can be queried in the file model, or by listenening to events dispatched by beads.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.file.beads.FileBrowser
classes.description: The FileBrowser class is a bead which adds to UploadImageProxy the ability to browse the file system and select a file.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.file.beads.FileBrowserWithFilter
classes.description: The FileBrowserWithFilter adds a filtering option to FileBrowser

classes.name: org.apache.royale.file.beads.FileLoader
classes.description: The FileLoader class is a bead which adds to UploadImageProxy the ability to browse the file system and select a file.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.file.beads.FileLoaderAndUploader
classes.description: The FileLoaderAndUploader is a compound bead that allows you to load a file and upload it in one operation.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.file.beads.FileModel
classes.description: The FileModel class is a bead that contains basic information on the file referenced by FileProxy

classes.name: org.apache.royale.file.beads.FileModelWithParams
classes.description: The FileModelWithParams class should allow sending a file with parameters. The js implementation uses FormData.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.file.beads.FileModelWithParamsAndFileContent
classes.description: The FileModelWithParamsAndFileContent behaves like FileModelWithParams but retains the file content. This can be useful e.g. for displaying a thumbnail of a file you are about to upload in FormData format.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.file.beads.FileUploader
classes.description: The FileUploader class is a bead which adds to FileProxy the ability to upload files.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.file.beads.FileUploaderWithResponseData
classes.description: FileUploaderWithResponseData records responseData before dispatching the complete event

classes.description: The BlendBead class translates HTML mixBlendMode CSS values to flash. The JS implementation is degenerated and exists only to enable output agnostic compilation.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.graphics.utils.AdvancedLayoutFeatures
classes.description: Transform Offsets can be assigned to any Component or GraphicElement to modify the transform of the object beyond where its parent layout places it.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.graphics.utils.CompoundTransform
classes.description: A CompoundTransform represents a 2D or 3D matrix transform.  A compound transform represents a matrix that can be queried or set either as a 2D matrix, a 3D matrix, or as individual convenience transform properties such as x, y, scaleX, rotationZ, etc.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.graphics.utils.IAssetLayoutFeatures
classes.description: The IAssetLayoutFeatures interface defines the minimum properties and methods required for an Object to support advanced transforms in embedded assets.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.graphics.utils.MatrixUtil
classes.description: The MatrixUtil class is for internal use only. Class for matrix and geometric related math routines.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.graphics.utils.TransformOffsets
classes.description: A CompoundTransform represents a 2D or 3D matrix transform. It can be used in the postLayoutTransformOffsets property on a UIComponent or GraphicElement.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.graphics.utils.shaderClasses.ColorBurnShader
classes.description:
Creates a blend shader that is equivalent to the 'Color Burn' blend mode for RGB premultiplied colors available in Adobe Creative Suite tools. This blend mode is not native to Flash, but is available in tools like Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop.

The 'colorburn' blend mode can be set on Flex groups and graphic elements and the visual appearance in tools like Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop will be mimicked through this blend shader.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.graphics.utils.shaderClasses.ColorDodgeShader
classes.description:
Creates a blend shader that is equivalent to the 'Color Dodge' blend mode for RGB premultiplied colors available in Adobe Creative Suite tools. This blend mode is not native to Flash, but is available in tools like Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop.

The 'colordodge' blend mode can be set on Flex groups and graphic elements. The visual appearance in tools like Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop will be mimicked through this blend shader.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.graphics.utils.shaderClasses.ColorShader
classes.description: The ColorShader class creates a blend shader that is equivalent to the 'Color' blend mode for RGB premultiplied colors available in Adobe Creative Suite tools. This blend mode is not native to Flash, but is available in tools like Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop.  The 'color' blend mode can be set on Flex groups and graphic elements and the visual appearance in tools like Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop will be mimicked through this blend shader.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.graphics.utils.shaderClasses.ExclusionShader
classes.description:
Creates a blend shader that is equivalent to the 'Exclusion' blend mode for RGB premultiplied colors available in Adobe Creative Suite tools. This blend mode is not native to Flash, but is available in tools like Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop.

The 'exclusion' blend mode can be set on Flex groups and graphic elements. The visual appearance in tools like Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop will be mimicked through this blend shader.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.graphics.utils.shaderClasses.HueShader
classes.description:
Creates a blend shader that is equivalent to the 'Hue' blend mode for RGB premultiplied colors available in Adobe Creative Suite tools. This blend mode is not native to Flash, but is available in tools like Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop.

The 'hue' blend mode can be set on Flex groups and graphic elements. The visual appearance in tools like Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop will be mimicked through this blend shader.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.graphics.utils.shaderClasses.LuminosityMaskShader
classes.description:
Creates a blend shader that is equivalent to the luminosity masking option (also known as soft masking) available in Adobe Creative Suite tools. This mask type is not native to Flash, but is available in tools like Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop.

A luminosity mask type can be set on Flex groups and graphic elements. The visual appearance in tools like Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop will be mimicked through this blend shader.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.graphics.utils.shaderClasses.LuminosityShader
classes.description:
Creates a blend shader that is equivalent to the 'Luminosity' blend mode for RGB premultiplied colors available in Adobe Creative Suite tools. This blend mode is not native to Flash, but is available in tools like Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop.

The 'luminosity' blend mode can be set on Flex groups and graphic elements. The visual appearance in tools like Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop will be mimicked through this blend shader.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.graphics.utils.shaderClasses.SaturationShader
classes.description:
Creates a blend shader that is equivalent to the 'Saturation' blend mode for RGB premultiplied colors available in Adobe Creative Suite tools. This blend mode is not native to Flash, but is available in tools like Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop.

The 'saturation' blend mode can be set on Flex groups and graphic elements. The visual appearance in tools like Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop will be mimicked through this blend shader.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.graphics.utils.shaderClasses.SoftLightShader
classes.description:
Creates a blend shader that is equivalent to the 'Soft Light' blend mode for RGB premultiplied colors available in Adobe Creative Suite tools. This blend mode is not native to Flash, but is available in tools like Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop.

The 'softlight' blend mode can be set on Flex groups and graphic elements. The visual appearance in tools like Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop will be mimicked through this blend shader.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Accordion
classes.description: The Accordion class used to display a list of collapsible components All but the selected item are expected to be collapsed.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Alert
classes.description: The Alert class is a component that displays a message and one or more buttons in a view that pops up over all other controls and views. The Alert component uses the AlertView bead to display a modal dialog with a title and a variety of buttons configured through the flag property of its show() static function. The Alert component uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the Alert. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView: the bead used to create the parts of the Alert. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead used to handle input events. org.apache.royale.html.beads.IBorderBead: if present, draws a border around the Alert. org.apache.royale.html.beads.IBackgroundBead: if present, places a solid color background below the Alert.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.BinaryImage
classes.description: The Image class is a component that displays a bitmap. The Image uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the Image, including the url/binary property. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView: constructs the visual elements of the component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Button
classes.description: The Button class is a simple button.  Use TextButton for buttons that should show text.  This is the lightest weight button used for non-text buttons like the arrow buttons in a Scrollbar or NumericStepper.  The most common view for this button is CSSButtonView that allows you to specify a backgroundImage in CSS that defines the look of the button.  However, when used in ScrollBar and when composed in many other components, it is more common to assign a custom view to the button.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.ButtonBar
classes.description: The ButtonBar class is a component that displays a set of Buttons. The ButtonBar is actually a List with a default horizontal layout and an itemRenderer that produces Buttons. The ButtonBar uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the ButtonBar, including the dataProvider. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView: constructs the parts of the component. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: handles input events. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadLayout: sizes and positions the component parts. org.apache.royale.core.IDataProviderItemRendererMapper: produces itemRenderers. org.apache.royale.core.IItemRenderer: the class or class factory to use.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.ButtonBase
classes.description: The ButtonBase class is the base class for Button.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.CSSCheckBox
classes.description: The CSSCheckBox class implements the common user interface control.  The CSSCheckBox includes its text label and is styleable using CSS. To style the checkbox control, a `checkClassName` should be specified which corresponds to a CSS class name.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.CascadingMenu
classes.description: The CascadingMenu class displays a list of selections with a potential for displaying a sub-list and a sub-sub-list etc. depending on how the data is organized.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.CascadingMenuWithOnScreenCheck
classes.description: The CascadingMenuWithOnScreenCheck adjusts the position to make sure it is on-screen.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.CheckBox
classes.description: The CheckBox class implements the common user interface control.  The CheckBox includes its text label.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.CloseButton
classes.description: The CloseButton class is Button that displays an X and is commonly used in a Panel's TitleBar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.ColorPicker
classes.description: The ColorPicker class is a component that lets you select a color

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.ComboBox
classes.description: The ComboBox class is a component that displays an input field and pop-up List with selections. Selecting an item from the pop-up List places that item into the input field of the ComboBox. The ComboBox uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the dataProvider, selectedItem, and so forth. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the component. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead that handles input and output.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Container
classes.description: The Container class implements a basic container for other controls and containers.  The position and size of the children are determined by a layout while the size of a Container can either be determined by its children or by specifying an exact size in pixels or as a percentage of the parent element.  This Container does not have a built-in scroll bar or clipping of its content should the content exceed the Container's boundaries. To have scroll bars and clipping, add the ScrollingView bead.  While the container is relatively lightweight, it should generally not be used as the base class for other controls, even if those controls are composed of children.  That's because the fundamental API of Container is to support an arbitrary set of children, and most controls only support a specific set of children.  And that's one of the advantages of beads: that functionality used in a Container can also be used in a Control as long as that bead doesn't assume that its strand is a Container.  For example, even though you can use a Panel to create the equivalent of an Alert control, the Alert is a control and not a Container because the Alert does not support an arbitrary set of children.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.ControlBar
classes.description: The ControlBar class is used within a Panel as a place to position additional controls. The ControlBar appears at the bottom of the org.apache.royale.html.Panel and is not part of the Panel's scrollable content area. The ControlBar is a Container and implements the org.apache.royale.core.IChrome interface, indicating that is outside of the Container's content area. The ControlBar uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the component. org.apache.royale.core.IMeasurementBead: helps determine the overlay size of the ControlBar for layout. org.apache.royale.html.beads.IBorderBead: if present, displays a border around the component. org.apache.royale.html.beads.IBackgroundBead: if present, displays a solid background below the ControlBar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.DataContainer
classes.description: The DataContainer class is a component that displays multiple data items. The DataContainer uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the dataProvider. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the list. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead that handles input and output. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadLayout: the bead responsible for the size and position of the itemRenderers. org.apache.royale.core.IDataProviderItemRendererMapper: the bead responsible for creating the itemRenders. org.apache.royale.core.IItemRenderer: the class or factory used to display an item in the list.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.DataGrid
classes.description: The DataGrid class displays a collection of data using columns and rows. Each column represents a specific field in the data set; each row represents a specific datum. The DataGrid is a composite component built with a org.apache.royale.html.ButtonBar for the column headers and a org.apache.royale.html.List for each column. The DataGrid's view bead (usually org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataGridView) constructs these parts while itemRenderer factories contruct the elements to display the data in each cell.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.DataGridButtonBar
classes.description: The DataGridButtonBar class extends ButtonBar and provides a class for styling the header region of the DataGrid.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.DataGridButtonBarTextButton
classes.description: The DataGridButtonBarTextButton class extends TextButton so that the buttons used in the DataGrid header can be styled separately from normal TextButtons.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.DateChooser
classes.description: The DateChooser class is a component that displays a calendar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.DateField
classes.description: The DateField class provides an input field where a date can be entered and a pop-up calendar control for picking a date as an alternative to the text field.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.DividedContainer
classes.description: The DividedContainer lays out its children (either horizontally or vertically, depending on which layout is used) separated by dividers. The dividers can be moved to grow and shrink the children.  This is the base class. See HDividedContainer and VDividedContainer for useful implementations.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.DropDownList
classes.description: The DropDownList class implements the basic equivalent of the <select> tag in HTML. The default implementation only lets the user see and choose from an array of strings. More complex controls would display icons as well as strings, or colors instead of strings or just about anything. The default behavior only lets the user choose one and only one item. More complex controls would allow mutiple selection by not dismissing the dropdown as soon as a selection is made.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Form
classes.description: The Form class is a simple form.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Group
classes.description: The Group class provides a light-weight container for visual elements. By default the Group does not have a layout, allowing its children to be sized and positioned using styles or CSS.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.HContainer
classes.description: A Container that has a HorizontalLayout. This is effectively the same as the pattern

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.HDividedContainer
classes.description: This sub-class of DividedContainer organizes its children into columns separated by movable dividers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.HGroup
classes.description: This Group subclass uses HorizontalLayout as its default layout.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.HRule
classes.description: The HRule class displays a horizontal line

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.HTMLText
classes.description: The HTMLText class implements the basic control for adding HTML formatted text.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.HueSelector
classes.description: The HueSelector is a slider that lets you select a hue for a color picker.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.IListPresentationModel
classes.description: The IListPresentationModel interface holds key values for the display of lists.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Image
classes.description: Load Images.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.ImageAndTextButton
classes.description: The ImageTextButton class implements a basic button that displays and image and text.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.ImageButton
classes.description: The ImageButton class presents an image as a button.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Label
classes.description: The Label class implements the basic control for labeling other controls.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.List
classes.description: The List class is a component that displays multiple data items. The List uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the dataProvider, selectedItem, and so forth. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the list. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead that handles input and output. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadLayout: the bead responsible for the size and position of the itemRenderers. org.apache.royale.core.IDataProviderItemRendererMapper: the bead responsible for creating the itemRenders. org.apache.royale.core.IItemRenderer: the class or factory used to display an item in the list.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.LoadIndicator
classes.description: The loader class provides an animated indicator

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.MXMLBeadView
classes.description: The MXMLBeadView class extends ContainerView and adds support for databinding and specification of children in MXML.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Menu
classes.description: The Menu class builds pop-up menus that are presented as a list, displayed at a specific location. The dataProvider should be an Array of either Strings or Objects; if Objects, set the Menu's labelField to identify the property in the Object to use for the labels in the Menu.  Use createMenu to create a Menu and add an event listener to be triggered when a menu item is selected.  var menu:Menu = Menu.createMenu(dataProvider); menu.addEventListener("change", handleSelection);  Present the menu using the show function: menu.show(component, xoffset, yoffset);  Pass a component to use a reference when calculating the position of the menu. Set an offset from the component's upper-left corner. If an item is selected the event listener will be called.  Remove the menu using menu.hide();  Note: submenus are not supported.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.MenuBar
classes.description: The MenuBar class is a list that, when an item is tapped, displays a menu of selections.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.MultiSelectionList
classes.description: The MultiSelectionList class is a component that displays multiple data items. The MultiSelectionList uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the dataProvider, selectedItems, and so forth. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the list. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead that handles input and output. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadLayout: the bead responsible for the size and position of the itemRenderers. org.apache.royale.core.IDataProviderItemRendererMapper: the bead responsible for creating the itemRenders. org.apache.royale.core.IItemRenderer: the class or factory used to display an item in the list.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.MultiSelectionTree
classes.description: The MultiSelectionTree class is a component that displays multiple data items. The MultiSelectionTree uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the dataProvider, selectedItems, and so forth. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the tree. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead that handles input and output. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadLayout: the bead responsible for the size and position of the itemRenderers. org.apache.royale.core.IDataProviderItemRendererMapper: the bead responsible for creating the itemRenders. org.apache.royale.core.IItemRenderer: the class or factory used to display an item in the tree.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.MultilineLabel
classes.description: The MultilineLabel class implements the basic control for displaying multiline labels.
