classes.description: The ArrayColorSelectionModel class is a color selection model for a dataProvider that is an array.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ArrayListSelectionModel
classes.description: The ArrayListSelectionModel class is a selection model for a dataProvider that is an ArrayList. It assumes that items can be fetched from the dataProvider using dataProvider.getItemAt(index).

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ArrayMultiSelectionModel
classes.description: The ArrayMultiSelectionModel class is a selection model for a dataProvider that is an array. It assumes that items can be fetched from the dataProvider dataProvider[index].  Other selection models would support other kinds of data providers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ArraySelectionModel
classes.description: The ArraySelectionModel class is a selection model for a dataProvider that is an array. It assumes that items can be fetched from the dataProvider dataProvider[index].  Other selection models would support other kinds of data providers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.BinaryImageModel
classes.description: The ImageModel class bead defines the data associated with an org.apache.royale.html.Image component, namely the source of the image.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ButtonBarModel
classes.description: The ArraySelectionModel class is a selection model for a dataProvider that is an array. It assumes that items can be fetched from the dataProvider dataProvider[index].  Other selection models would support other kinds of data providers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ColorModel
classes.description: The ColorModel class is the most basic data model for a component that displays or edits a color.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ColorSpectrumModel
classes.description: The ColorSpectrumModel class is the most basic data model for a component that displays or edits a color spectrum.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ComboBoxModel
classes.description: The ComboBoxModel class bead extends org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ArraySelectionModel and adds the text being displayed by the org.apache.royale.html.ComboBox's input field.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.DataGridCollectionViewModel
classes.description: The DataGridCollectiomModel class bead extends org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.SingleSelectionCollectionViewModel to facilitate using an ICollectionView as the dataProvider for the DataGrid. Use this with org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataItemRenderFactoryForCollectionView for each DataGridColumn.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.DataGridModel
classes.description: The DataGridModel class bead extends org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ArraySelectionModel to facilitate using an Array as the dataProvider for the DataGrid.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.DataGridPresentationModel
classes.description: The DataGridPresentationModel class contains the data to label the columns of the org.apache.royale.html.DataGrid along with the height of the rows.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.DataProviderModel
classes.description: The DataProviderModel class is a model for a dataProvider and an optional labelField.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.DateChooserModel
classes.description: The DateChooserModel is a bead class that manages the data for a DataChooser. This includes arrays of names for the months and days of the week as well the currently selected date.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.DividedContainerModel
classes.description: The DividedContainerModel holds the information necessary for the DividedContainer to size and layout its children as well as to respond to changes in those sizes made by the DividedContainerDividers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ImageAndTextModel
classes.description: The ImageAndTextModel class is associates and image with some text.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ImageModel
classes.description: The ImageModel class bead defines the data associated with an org.apache.royale.html.Image component, namely the source of the image.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ListPresentationModel
classes.description: The ListPresentationModel holds values used by list controls for presenting their user interfaces.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.MenuBarModel
classes.description: The model used by the MenuBar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.MenuModel
classes.description: The model used to support menus.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.MultiSelectionCollectionViewModel
classes.description: The MultiSelectionCollectionViewModel class is a selection model for a dataProvider that is an ICollectionView. It assumes that items can be fetched from the dataProvider using dataProvider.getItemAt(index).

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.MultiSelectionTreeModel
classes.description: The MultiSelectionTreeModel is used by Tree

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.NonNullTextModel
classes.description: The TextModel class is most basic data model for a component that displays text.  All Royale components that display text should also support HTML, although the Flash Player implementations may only support a subset of HTML.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.PanelModel
classes.description: The PanelModel bead class holds the values for a org.apache.royale.html.Panel, such as its title.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.RangeModel
classes.description: The RangeModel class bead defines a set of for a numeric range of values which includes a minimum, maximum, and current value.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.RangeModelExtended
classes.description: The RangeModelExtended bead expands on the RangeModel and adds a function to display a value from the model.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ScrollBarModel
classes.description: The ScrollBarModel class bead extends the org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.RangeModel and adds page size and page step sizes.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.SingleLineBorderModel
classes.description: The SingleLineBorderModel class is a data model for a single line border. This model is very simple, it only stores the offsets from the edges of the component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.SingleSelectionCollectionViewModel
classes.description: The SingleSelectionCollectionViewModel class is a selection model for a dataProvider that is an ICollectionView. It assumes that items can be fetched from the dataProvider using dataProvider.getItemAt(index).

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.StringSelectionModel
classes.description: The StringSelectionModel class is a selection model for selecting a single string from a vector of strings.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.TextModel
classes.description: The TextModel class is most basic data model for a component that displays text.  All Royale components that display text should also support HTML, although the Flash Player implementations may only support a subset of HTML.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.TitleBarModel
classes.description: The TitleBarModel class bead holds the values for the org.apache.royale.html.TitleBar's properties.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ToggleButtonModel
classes.description: The ToggleButtonModel class bead holds values for org.apache.royale.html.Buttons that have a state.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.TreeGridModel
classes.description: The data model for the TreeGrid. This contains the list of TreeGridColumn definitions.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.TreeModel
classes.description: The TreeModel is used by Tree

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ValueToggleButtonModel
classes.description: The ValueToggleButtonModel class bead extends the org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ToggleButtonModel and adds value intended to represent a collection of similar org.apache.royale.html.Buttons such as org.apache.royale.html.RadioButtons.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.WebBrowserModel
classes.description: The WebBrowserModel class bead defines the data associated with an org.apache.royale.html.WebBrowser component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.A
classes.description: The A(Anchor) class represents an HTML <a> anchor element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.B
classes.description: The B(Bold) class represents an HTML <b> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.Button
classes.description: The Button class represents an HTML <button> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.Caption
classes.description: The Caption class represents an HTML <caption> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.Code
classes.description: The Code class represents an HTML <code> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.Col
classes.description: The Col class represents an HTML <col> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.Colgroup
classes.description: The Colgroup class represents an HTML <colgroup> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.Div
classes.description: The Div class represents an HTML <div> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.Em
classes.description: The Em(Emphasis) class represents an HTML <em> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.Footer
classes.description: The Footer class represents an HTML <footer> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.Form
classes.description: The Form class represents an HTML <form> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.H1
classes.description: The H1 class represents an HTML <h1> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.H2
classes.description: The H2 class represents an HTML <h2> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.H3
classes.description: The H3 class represents an HTML <h3> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.H4
classes.description: The H4 class represents an HTML <h4> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.H5
classes.description: The H5 class represents an HTML <h5> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.H6
classes.description: The H6 class represents an HTML <h6> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.Header
classes.description: The Header class represents an HTML <header> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.Hr
classes.description: The Hr class represents an HTML <hr> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.I
classes.description: The I(Italic) class represents an HTML <i> anchor element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.elements.Iframe
classes.description: The Iframe class represents an HTML <iframe> element https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/iframe

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.AlternatingBackgroundColorStringItemRenderer
classes.description: The AlternatingBackgroundColorStringItemRenderer class displays data in string form using the data's toString() function and alternates between two background colors.  This is the most simple implementation for immutable lists and will not handle adding/removing renderers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.Border
classes.description: The Border class is a class used internally by many controls to draw a border.  The border actually drawn is dictated by the IBeadView in the CSS.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.ButtonBarButtonItemRenderer
classes.description: The ButtonBarButtonItemRenderer class handles the display of each item for the org.apache.royale.html.ButtonBar component. This class uses a org.apache.royale.html.Button to represent the data.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.CascadingMenuItemRenderer
classes.description: The CascadingMenuItemRenderer is the itemRenderer class for the elements of a CascadingMenu. Each item can either be a label or a separator (indicated by type:"separator" in the data for the item). If there is a sub-menu (indicated by menu:[array of items] in the data for the item), a sub-menu indicator is displayed next to the label.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.ClippingViewport
classes.description: The ClippingViewport extends the Viewport class and makes sure that items extending outside the Container are hidden.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.ColorItemRenderer
classes.description: The ColorItemRenderer class displays a color as part of a color palette

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.ColorPalette
classes.description: The ColorPalette class is used in a ColorPicker. It contains a list of predefined colors.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.ColorPickerPopUp
classes.description: The ColorPickerPopUp class is used in ColorPicker. It contains a set of controls for picking a color.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.ColorPickerPopUpWithPalette
classes.description: The ColorPickerPopUpWithPalette class is used in ColorPicker. It contains a set of controls for picking a color, incluse a color palette.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.ColorSpectrum
classes.description: The ColorSpectrum class is use in a ColorPicker. It defines a base color and the spectrum of colors around it, ranging from black to transparent, and from that base color to white.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.ComboBoxList
classes.description: The ComboBoxList class is the List class used internally by ComboBox as the dropdown/popup.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.ContainerContentArea
classes.description: The ContainerContentArea class implements the contentView for a Container on the SWF platform.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.DataGridButtonBarButtonItemRenderer
classes.description: The ButtonBarButtonItemRenderer class handles the display of each item for the org.apache.royale.html.ButtonBar component. This class uses a org.apache.royale.html.Button to represent the data.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.DataGridColumn
classes.description: The DataGridColumn class is the collection of properties that describe a column of the org.apache.royale.html.DataGrid: which renderer to use for each cell in the column, the width of the column, the label for the column, and the name of the field in the data containing the value to display in the column.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.DataGridColumnList
classes.description: The DataGridColumnList class is the List class used internally by DataGrid for each column.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.DataGroup
classes.description: The DataGroup class is the IItemRendererOwnerView used internally by org.apache.royale.html.List class.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.DataItemRenderer
classes.description: The DataItemRenderer class is the base class for most itemRenderers. This class extends org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.UIItemRendererBase and includes row and column index values.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.DataProviderNotifierBase
classes.description: Base class for all data provider notifiers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.DateChooserButton
classes.description: The DateChooserButton class is used for each button in the DateChooser. The button holds the day of the month the button is representing.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.DateChooserHeader
classes.description: The DateChooserHeader is the container for the days of the week labels in the DateChooser.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.DateFieldDateChooser
classes.description: The DateFieldDateChooser class is the DateChooser class used internally by DateField as the dropdown/popup.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.DateHeaderButton
classes.description: The DateHeaderButton class is used for the buttons in the DateChooser's heading areas.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.DateItemRenderer
classes.description: The DateItemRenderer class renders date values for the DateChooser.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.DayNameItemRenderer
classes.description: The DayNameItemRenderer class renders the names of days of the week for the DateChooser.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.DividedContainerDivider
classes.description: The DividedContainerSeparator is a control that lays between the children of a DividedContainer. This is the base class for the HDividedContainerDivider and VDividedContainerDivider.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.DropDownListList
classes.description: The DropDownListList class is the List class used internally by DropDownList as the dropdown/popup.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.GraphicsItemRenderer
classes.description: The GraphicsItemRenderer provides a base class for itemRenderers that use graphics rather than components.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.HDividedContainerDivider
classes.description: This sub-class of DividerBoxDivider sets up a vertical divider between the columns of an HDividedContainer.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.HDividedContainerGripper
classes.description: The HDividedContainerGripper is a bead added to the HDividedContainerDivider to provide a visual cue that the divider can be grabbed and moved.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.HScrollBar
classes.description: The ScrollBar class represents either a vertical or horizontal control that allows the user to quickly scan through a component that does not wholly fit within its container.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.IColorPickerPopUp
classes.description: All color picker pop-ups must implement this interface.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.IDataGridColumnList
classes.description: The IDataGridColumnList interface is a marker interface for DataGrid Column Lists

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.IDividedContainerDivider
classes.description: All DividerBoxDividers must implement this interface.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.IDividedContainerGripper
classes.description: This interface defines a gripper bead control for a DividedContainer.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.MXMLItemRenderer
classes.description: The MXMLItemRenderer class is the base class for itemRenderers that are MXML-based and provides support for a layout and a data object.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.MXMLStatesItemRenderer
classes.description: The MXMLStatesItemRenderer class gives view states support for MXML-based item renderers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.MenuItemRenderer
classes.description: The MenuItemRenderer class is the default itemRenderer for Menus.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.NestedStringItemRenderer
classes.description: The NestedStringItemRenderer can be used with lists or DataGridColumns for items that are not at the top level of the data. For example, if the data is an Object having: {title: "Something", address:{street: "Main", zip: "02118"}} using NestedStringItemRenderer for the address field can extract any of its consitutents: labelField="address.zip".

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.OverflowViewport
classes.description: A OverflowViewport is the area of a Container set aside for displaying content. If the content exceeds the visible area of the viewport it will show.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.PanelContent
classes.description: A Container specialized for the content area of a Panel. Needed for its type name

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.PanelLayoutProxy
classes.description: The PanelLayoutProxy class is used by Panel in order for layouts to operate on the Panel itself. If Panel were being used, its numElements, getElementAt, etc. functions would actually redirect to its Container content. In order for a layout to work on the Panel directly (its TitleBar, Container, and ControlBar children), this proxy is used which will invoke the Panel's $numElements, $getElementAt, etc functions.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.RadioButtonIcon
classes.description: The RadioButton class is a component that displays a selectable Button. RadioButtons are typically used in groups, identified by the groupName property. RadioButton use the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the groupName. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the RadioButton..

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.ScrollBar
classes.description: The ScrollBar class represents either a vertical or horizontal control that allows the user to quickly scan through a component that does not wholly fit within its container.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.StringItemRenderer
classes.description: The StringItemRenderer class displays data in string form using the data's toString() function.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.StyledBaseMXMLItemRenderer
classes.description: The MXMLItemRenderer class is the base class for itemRenderers that are MXML-based and provides support for a layout and a data object.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.StyledDataItemRenderer
classes.description: The DataItemRenderer class is the base class for most itemRenderers. This class extends org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.UIItemRendererBase and includes row and column index values.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.StyledMXMLStatesItemRenderer
classes.description: The StyledMXMLStatesItemRenderer class gives view states support for MXML-based item renderers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.StyledUIItemRendererBase
classes.description: The StyledUIItemRendererBase is an UIItemRendererBase that support the StyledUIBase base class

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.TextButtonItemRenderer
classes.description: The TextButtonItemRenderer class extends TextButton and turns it into an itemRenderer suitable for use in most DataContainer/List/DataGrid applications.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.TextFieldItemRenderer
classes.description: The TextFieldItemRenderer class provides a org.apache.royale.html.TextField as an itemRenderer.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.TreeGridColumn
classes.description: A TreeGridColumn defines the property of a specific column in the TreeGrid.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.TreeListData
classes.description: The TreeListData class contains information that Tree item renderers may find useful when displaying the data for a node in the tree.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.TreeXMLItemRenderer
classes.description: JS needs special handling for XML.  It can't do [] lookups.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.UIItemRendererBase
classes.description: The UIItemRendererBase class is the base class for all itemRenderers. An itemRenderer is used to display a single datum within a collection of data. Components such as a List use itemRenderers to show their dataProviders.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.VDividedContainerDivider
classes.description: This sub-class of DividedContainerDivider sets up a horizontal divider between the rows of a VDividedContainer.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.VDividedContainerGripper
classes.description: The VDividedContainerGripper bead adds a visual cue to the VDividedContainerDivider to indicate where to start dragging to change the size of the elements.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.VScrollBar
classes.description: The ScrollBar class represents either a vertical or horizontal control that allows the user to quickly scan through a component that does not wholly fit within its container.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.Viewport
classes.description: A Viewport is the area of a Container set aside for displaying content. If the content exceeds the visible area of the viewport it will be clipped or hidden.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html5.Label
classes.description: Label probably should extend TextField directly, but the player's APIs for TextLine do not allow direct instantiation, and we might want to allow Labels to be declared and have their actual view be swapped out.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html5.List
classes.description: Label probably should extend TextField directly, but the player's APIs for TextLine do not allow direct instantiation, and we might want to allow Labels to be declared and have their actual view be swapped out.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.icons.FontAwesomeIcon
classes.description: Icons can be used alone or in buttons and other controls  This class could be used with any icon family out there and with its text property

classes.name: org.apache.royale.icons.FontAwesomeToggleIcon
classes.description: A FontAwesome based toggle icon can be used alone or in buttons and other controls. This icons has two states, selected and unselected showing different icons in each one.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.icons.FontIconBase
classes.description: FontIconBase is the base class to provide most common features for all kinds of text based icons

classes.name: org.apache.royale.icons.MaterialIcon
classes.description: A Material based icon can be used alone or in buttons and other controls

classes.name: org.apache.royale.icons.MaterialToggleIcon
classes.description: A Material based toggle icon can be used alone or in buttons and other controls. This icons has two states, selected and unselected showing different icons in each one.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Alert
classes.description: The Alert class is a component that displays a message and one or more buttons in a view that pops up over all other controls and views. The Alert component uses the AlertView bead to display a modal dialog with a title and a variety of buttons configured through the flag property of its show() static function. The Alert component uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the Alert. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView: the bead used to create the parts of the Alert. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead used to handle input events. org.apache.royale.core.IBorderBead: if present, draws a border around the Alert. org.apache.royale.core.IBackgroundBead: if present, places a solid color background below the Alert.  Note: Alert use the HTML <dialog> element, which currently has very limited cross-browser support. To ensure support across all modern browsers, we use use dialogPolyfill extern or creating your own. The required Dialog Polyfill lines are injected in the constructor

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Application
classes.description: The Application class is the main class and entry point for a Royale application and does not contain user interface elements. Those UI elements go in the view (Jewel ViewBase).  This Application class expects there to be a main model, a controller, and an initial view.  Jewel Application holds specific Jewel needs in a Royale Application. This class extends the standard ApplicationBase and sets up the AllCSSValuesImpl implementation for convenience.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.ApplicationMainContent
classes.description: The ApplicationMainContent class is a Container component capable of parenting the other organized content that implements ISelectableContent interface (i.e, a SectionContent)

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Bar
classes.description: The Bar class is a container component for different items like a title, navigation icon, and/or icon buttons. Normaly is located at the top or bottom of a container and use to fill all horizontal availale space. It's responsive as screen size changes

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.BinaryImage
classes.description: The Image class is a component that displays a bitmap. The Image uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the Image, including the url/binary property. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView: constructs the visual elements of the component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Button
classes.description: The Jewel Button class adds text capabilities to Jewel SimpleButton.  Button is a commonly used rectangular button with text inside. It looks like it can be pressed and allow users to take actions, and make choices, with a single click or tap. It typically use event listeners to perform an action when the user interact with the control. When a user clicks the mouse or tap with the finger this control it dispatches a click event.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.ButtonBar
classes.description: The Jewel ButtonBar class is a component that displays a set of Buttons. The ButtonBar is actually a List with a default horizontal layout and an itemRenderer that produces Jewel Buttons.  By default buttons are equally sized, by setting `widthType` to NaN.  The ButtonBar uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the ButtonBar, including the dataProvider. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView: constructs the parts of the component. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: handles input events. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadLayout: sizes and positions the component parts. org.apache.royale.core.IDataProviderItemRendererMapper: produces itemRenderers. org.apache.royale.core.IItemRenderer: the class or class factory to use.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Card
classes.description: The Card class is a container for content like text or images that support optional parts like title and actions (usually buttons).  Card has a default "panel" style and can compose other containers like CardHeader, CardPrimaryContent, CardExpandedContent and CardActions

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.CheckBox
classes.description: The Jewel CheckBox consists of a box, that can contain a check mark or not, and an optional label.  When a user clicks or touches this control or its associated text, the CheckBox changes its state from checked to unchecked or from unchecked to checked, communicating clearly a binary condition.  Checkboxes can appear in groups (but not necesarily), and can be selected and deselected individually.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.ComboBox
classes.description: The ComboBox class is a component that displays an input field and pop-up List with selections. Selecting an item from the pop-up List places that item into the input field of the ComboBox. The ComboBox uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the dataProvider, selectedItem, and so forth. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the component. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead that handles input and output.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Container
classes.description: The Jewel Container class is a container that adds up to the features already provided by Jewel Group.  The position and size of the children are determined by BasicLayout while the size of a Container can either be determined by its children or by specifying an exact size in pixels or as a percentage of the parent element. You can swap the layout for any other one available making children arrange in different ways (i.e: horizontal, vertical,...)  Container clip content by default thanks to its Viewport bead. This bead can also manage clipping trough `clipContent` property. To add scrolling functionality Viewport bead can be changed by ScrollingViewport.  Other Group feature are "View States" to provide state management to show diferent parts to the user.  Finally Container can add elements directly to the strand (throught `strandChildren` property) instead to its view content unlike the `addElement()` APIs which place children into the contentView.  While the container is relatively lightweight, it should generally not be used as the base class for other controls, even if those controls are composed of children.  That's because the fundamental API of Container is to support an arbitrary set of children, and most controls only support a specific set of children.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.DataContainer
classes.description: The Jewel DataContainer class is a component that displays multiple data items.  This component gets the data through its `dataProvider` property that receives an `ArrayList` of data objects. To represent each item the component use an [ItemRenderer](/features/item-renderers) class that can be configured and customized.  The component generate dynamically as many instances of ItemRenderer as items in the data provider array and fill each instance with the appropiate data. By default it uses `StringItemRenderer` as the item renderer.  By default items are layout vertically using Jewel `VerticalLayout`. This component has a `Viewport` that clip generated items.  The DataContainer uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the dataProvider. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the list. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadLayout: the bead responsible for the size and position of the itemRenderers. org.apache.royale.core.IDataProviderItemRendererMapper: the bead responsible for creating the itemRenders. org.apache.royale.core.IItemRendererClassFactory: the factory for the itemrenders. org.apache.royale.core.IItemRenderer: the class that describes the each piece of data. org.apache.royale.core.IItemRendererInitializer: the class that initialize the renderer and provide additional configuration. org.apache.royale.core.IViewport: the class that defines the area that display content

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.DataGrid
classes.description: The DataGrid class displays a collection of data using columns and rows. Each column represents a specific field in the data set; each row represents a specific datum. The DataGrid is a composite component built with a org.apache.royale.jewel.ButtonBar for the column headers and a org.apache.royale.jewel.List for each column. The DataGrid's view bead (usually org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.DataGridView) constructs these parts while itemRenderer factories contruct the elements to display the data in each cell.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.DateChooser
classes.description: The DateChooser class is a component that displays a calendar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.DateField
classes.description: The DateField class provides an input field where a date can be entered and a pop-up calendar control for picking a date as an alternative to the text field.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Divider
classes.description: The Divider class is a component that shows a clear separation between two zones

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Drawer
classes.description: The Drawer class is a container component used for navigation that can be opened with the menu icon, or be always visible. It use to be positioned at the left (or right) side of the application screen.  It can be used in float or fixed modes.  float make the drawer appear over the screen without make any other application elements change size. Clicking outside the drawer will hide it. Usually clicking in some navigation option will hide it as well.  fixed will need some place and make the other application content shrink. Clicking on any navigation option in the drawer usually doesn't hide it.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.DropDownList
classes.description: The DropDownList class implements the basic equivalent of the <select> tag in HTML. The default implementation only lets the user see and choose from an array of strings. More complex controls would display icons as well as strings, or colors instead of strings or just about anything. The default behavior only lets the user choose one and only one item. More complex controls would allow mutiple selection by not dismissing the dropdown as soon as a selection is made.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.FooterBar
classes.description: The FooterBar class is a container component for different items like navigation icons and/or buttons. Normaly is located at the bottom of an application and use to fill all horizontal availale space. It's responsive as screen size changes

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Form
classes.description: The Form class works with all validators, which implements IPopUpHost can host error tips. strand with FormValidator to dispatch invalid/valid event.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.FormHeading
classes.description: FormHeading is a label, and option required indicator (no validation is implied) and a content with one or more controls

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.FormItem
classes.description: FormItem is a label, and option required indicator (no validation is implied) and a content with one or more controls

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Grid
classes.description: The Grid class is a container that uses Grid Layout. Grid Layout need other immediate children to work as cells to host cell content.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.GridCell
classes.description: The GridCell class is the inmediate container in a Grid Layout to host grid cell content.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Group
classes.description: The Jewel Group class provides a light-weight container for visual elements.  By default Group have a Basiclayout, allowing its children to be positioned using absolute values (Notice Basic version doesn't provide any layout at all). You can swap the layout for any other one available making children arrange in different ways (i.e: horizontal, vertical,...)  Group doesn't clip content so elements inside the group aren't hidden far beyond group boundaries. Also, no scrolling support is built in Group. Group doesn't have any chrome or visuals just position inner childs.  Other Group feature are "View States" to provide state management to show diferent parts to the user  For scrolling and clipping you can use Jewel Container

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.HContainer
classes.description: This Container subclass uses HorizontalLayout as its default layout.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.HGroup
classes.description: This Group subclass uses HorizontalLayout as its default layout.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.HSlider
classes.description: The Slider class is a component that displays a range of values using a track and a thumb control. The Slider uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, typically an IRangeModel, that holds the Slider values. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the Slider. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead that handles input. org.apache.royale.core.IThumbValue: the bead responsible for the display of the thumb control. org.apache.royale.core.ITrackView: the bead responsible for the display of the track.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.IconButton
classes.description: The IconButton class is a Button that supports icons.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.IconButtonBar
classes.description: The Jewel IconButtonBar class is a component that displays a set of IconButtons. The IconButtonBar is actually a ButtonBar with an itemRenderer that produces Jewel IconButtons.  By default buttons are equally sized, by setting `widthType` to NaN.  The IconButtonBar uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the ButtonBar, including the dataProvider. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView: constructs the parts of the component. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: handles input events. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadLayout: sizes and positions the component parts. org.apache.royale.core.IDataProviderItemRendererMapper: produces itemRenderers. org.apache.royale.core.IItemRenderer: the class or class factory to use.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.IconTextInput
classes.description: The IconTextInput class implements is a TextInput that supports an icon that can be positionend to the left or to the right of text content

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Image
classes.description: The Jewel Image is a simple component that loads an Image. For button images use ImageButton

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.ImageButton
classes.description: The ImageButton class presents an image as a button. In html is an input type="image", this shows the hand pointer cursor

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Label
classes.description: The Label class implements the basic control for labeling other controls.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.List
classes.description: The List class is a component that displays multiple data items. The List uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the dataProvider, selectedItem, and so forth. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the list. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead that handles input and output. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadLayout: the bead responsible for the size and position of the itemRenderers. org.apache.royale.core.IDataProviderItemRendererMapper: the bead responsible for creating the itemRenders. org.apache.royale.core.IItemRenderer: the class or factory used to display an item in the list. org.apache.royale.core.IItemRendererClassFactory: the factory for the itemrenders. org.apache.royale.core.ISelectableItemRenderer: handles selection and hover states for item renderers. org.apache.royale.core.IItemRendererInitializer: the class that initialize the renderer and provide additional configuration. org.apache.royale.core.IViewport: the class that defines the area that display content org.apache.royale.core.IBeadKeyController: add keyboard support to the list.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Module
classes.description: The UIModule class is the base class for modules of user interface controls in Royale.  It is usable as the root tag of MXML documents and UI controls and containers are added to it.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.ModuleLoader
classes.description: The Jewel ModuleLoader class can load a Jewel Module.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Navigation
classes.description: The Navigation class is a List used for navigate other organized content in a Royale Application. In HTML is represented by a <nav> tag in HTML and It parents a list of links. By default it uses NavigationLinkItemRenderer class to define each item.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.NumericStepper
classes.description: The NumericStepper class is a component that displays a numeric value and up/down controls (using a org.apache.royale.jewel.Spinner) to increase and decrease the value by specific amounts. The NumericStepper uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the component of type org.apache.royale.core.IRangeModel. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView: constructs the parts of the component. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: handles the input events.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.PopUp
classes.description: The PopUp class is a component that can popup another component declared as IPopUp

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.RadioButton
classes.description: The Jewel RadioButton control lets the user make a single choice within a set of mutually exclusive choices. A RadioButton consists of a circle and, typically, text that clearly communicates a condition that will be set when the user clicks or touches it. Radio buttons always appear in groups of two or more with the same groupName propert. While they can be individually selected, can only be deselected by selecting a different RadioButton in the same group (which deselects the rest of RadioButton).

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.ResponsiveView
classes.description: The ResponsiveView class is the main Container component capable of parenting other components in a responsive Jewel Application.  ResponsiveView doesn't need to specify `width` and `height` since are sized 100% in both directions by default. In this way we can use the width of the application container to apply responsive rules on any part of the application.  It normaly can host a TopAppBar, a Drawer and a Container with other organized content for navigation

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.ScrollableGrid
classes.description: The ScrollableGrid class is a Grid with scroll capabilities

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.ScrollableSectionContent
classes.description: The ScrollableSectionContent class is a scrollable container component capable of parenting other components. This class is used along with Tabs to separate content and present and organize data for the user.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.SectionContent
classes.description: The Jewel SectionContent class is a Container component capable of parenting other components. This class is used along with Tabs to separate content, present and organize data for the user.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.SimpleLoader
classes.description: The SimpleLoader class is widget used to show some progressing. It could be while loading dome data, or waiting for interface to complete some task.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.SimpleTable
classes.description: The SimpleTable class represents a simple HTML <table> element. This component is designed to be declarative in MXML (or AS3), Check Table component for a Table that uses itemRenderers, columns and a data provider.  This component uses the following jewel classes to generate the Table structure:  - Header: j:THead j:TableRow j:TableHeaderCell  - Body j:TBody j:TableRow j:TableCell  - Footer j:TFoot j:TableRow j:TableCell   As well, DataGrid is a more complex component

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Snackbar
classes.description: The Snackbar class is a component that provide brief messages about app processes at the bottom that pops up over all other controls. The Snackbar component uses the SnackbarView bead to display messages and can contain a single action which configured through the action property. Because Snackbar disappear automatically, the action shouldnt be Dismiss or Cancel. The Snackbar component uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the Snackbar. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView: the bead used to create the parts of the Snackbar. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead used to handle disappear automatically.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Spacer
classes.description: The Spacer class takes up space in the UI layout. Setting width and/or height

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Spinner
classes.description: The Spinner class is a component that displays a control for incrementing a value and a control for decrementing a value. The org.apache.royale.jewel.NumericStepper uses a Spinner as part of the component. Spinner uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: an IRangeModel to hold the properties. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the Spinner. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: a bead that handles the input events.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.TabBar
classes.description: The TabBar class is a List used for navigate other organized content in a Royale Application. In HTML is represented by a <nav> tag in HTML and It parents a list of links. By default it uses TabBarButtonItemRenderer class to define each item.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.TabBarContent
classes.description: The TabBarContent class is a Container component capable of parenting the other organized content that implements ISelectableContent interface (i.e, a SectionContent)

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Table
classes.description: The Table class represents an HTML <table> element.  This Table component uses a data mapper and item renderers to generate a Table from a data source, in opposite to SimpleTable component that is a declarative mxml.  As well, DataGrid is a more complex component

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.TextArea
classes.description: The TextArea implements the jewel control for multiline text field. It dispatches a change event when the user input text.  User can define number of rows and the max number of rows.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.TextInput
classes.description: The TextInput implements the jewel control for single-line text field. It dispatches a change event when the user input text.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.TitleBar
classes.description: The TitleBar class is a Container component that displays a title and an optional close button. The TitleBar uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the title and showCloseButton values. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the component. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadLayout: the bead that handles size and position of the component parts (org.apache.royale.html.Label and org.apache.royale.html.Button). org.apache.royale.core.IMeasurementBead: a bead that helps determine the size of the org.apache.royale.html.TitleBar for layout.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.ToggleButton
classes.description: The ToggleButton class is a Button that supports a selected property.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.ToggleButtonBar
classes.description: The Jewel ToggleButtonBar class is a component that displays a set of ToggleButtons. The ToggleButtonBar is actually an IconButtonBar with an itemRenderer that produces Jewel ToggleButtons.  By default buttons are equally sized, by setting `widthType` to NaN.  The ToggleButtonBar uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the ButtonBar, including the dataProvider. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView: constructs the parts of the component. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: handles input events. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadLayout: sizes and positions the component parts. org.apache.royale.core.IDataProviderItemRendererMapper: produces itemRenderers. org.apache.royale.core.IItemRenderer: the class or class factory to use.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.TopAppBar
classes.description: The TopAppBar class is a container component for different items like application title, navigation icon, and/or icon buttons. Normaly is located at the top of an application and use to fill all horizontal availale space. It's responsive as screen size changes

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.VContainer
classes.description: This Container subclass uses VerticalLayout as its default layout.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.VGroup
classes.description: This Group subclass uses VerticalLayout as its default layout.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.VSlider
classes.description: The VSlider class is a component that displays a range of values using a track and a thumb control vertically. The VSlider uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, typically an IRangeModel, that holds the VSlider values. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the VSlider. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead that handles input. org.apache.royale.core.IThumbValue: the bead responsible for the display of the thumb control. org.apache.royale.core.ITrackView: the bead responsible for the display of the track.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.View
classes.description: The View class is the class used as the initialView in a Royale Jewel Application.  It is generally used as the root tag of MXML documents and UI controls and containers are added to it.  For responsive applications you can use ResponsiveView instead.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.VirtualComboBox
classes.description: The VirtualComboBox class is a component that displays an input field and pop-up VirtualList with selections. Selecting an item from the pop-up List places that item into the input field of the ComboBox.  This component should be used when data provider has several items for performance improvements  The ComboBox uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the dataProvider, selectedItem, and so forth. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the component. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead that handles input and output.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.VirtualList
classes.description: The VirtualList class is a List component used for large data providers that need to create and recicle just the visible list renderers. The List uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the dataProvider, selectedItem, and so forth. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the list. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead that handles input and output. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadLayout: the bead responsible for the size and position of the itemRenderers. org.apache.royale.core.IDataProviderItemRendererMapper: the bead responsible for creating the itemRenders. org.apache.royale.core.IItemRenderer: the class or factory used to display an item in the list.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.Wizard
classes.description: Wizard is a container that navigates from one content to the next. The content is organized in wizard pages It can provide previous and next navigation buttons

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.WizardContent
classes.description: The WizardContent class is a Container component capable of parenting the other organized content that implements ISelectableContent interface (i.e, a SectionContent)

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.WizardPage
classes.description: WizardPage is the main class for a page inside the WizardContent

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controllers.AlertController
classes.description: The AlertControler class bead handles the close event on the org.apache.royale.jewwl.Alert by removing the org.apache.royale.jewel.Alert from the display.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controllers.ComboBoxController
classes.description: The ComboBoxController class is responsible for listening to mouse event related to ComboBox. Events such as selecting a item or changing the sectedItem.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controllers.DateChooserMouseController
classes.description: The DateChooserMouseController class is responsible for listening to mouse event related to the DateChooser. Events such as selecting a date or changing the calendar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controllers.DateFieldMouseController
classes.description: The DateFieldMouseController class is responsible for monitoring the mouse events on the elements of the DateField. A click on the DateField's menu button triggers the pop-up, for example.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controllers.DropDownListController
classes.description: The DropDownListController class is the controller for org.apache.royale.html.DropDownList.  Controllers watch for events from the interactive portions of a View and update the data model or dispatch a semantic event. This controller watches for the click event and displays the dropdown/popup, and watches the dropdown/popup for change events and updates the selection model accordingly.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controllers.ListKeyDownController
classes.description: The Jewel ListSingleSelectionMouseController class is a controller for org.apache.royale.jewel.List.  Controllers watch for events from the interactive portions of a View and update the data model or dispatch a semantic event. This controller watches for events from the item renderers and updates an ISelectionModel (which only supports single selection).  Other controller/model pairs would support various kinds of multiple selection.  Jewel controller takes into account if the component

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controllers.ListSingleSelectionMouseController
classes.description: The Jewel ListSingleSelectionMouseController class is a controller for org.apache.royale.jewel.List.  Controllers watch for events from the interactive portions of a View and update the data model or dispatch a semantic event. This controller watches for events from the item renderers and updates an ISelectionModel (which only supports single selection).  Other controller/model pairs would support various kinds of multiple selection.  Jewel controller takes into account if the component

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controllers.NumericStepperController
classes.description: The NumericStepperController class is responsible for listening to mouse event related to NumericStepper.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controllers.PopUpMouseController
classes.description: The PopUpMouseController class is responsible for monitoring the mouse events on the elements of the DateField. A click on the DateField's menu button triggers the pop-up, for example.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controllers.SliderMouseController
classes.description: The SliderMouseController class bead handles mouse events on the org.apache.royale.jewel.HSlider's component parts (thumb and track) and dispatches change events on behalf of the HSlider (as well as co-ordinating visual changes (such as moving the thumb when the track has been tapped or clicked). Use this controller for horizontally oriented Sliders.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controllers.SnackbarController
classes.description: The SnackbarController class bead handles duration of the Snackbar How long to show the Snackbar for.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controllers.SpinnerMouseController
classes.description: The SpinnerMouseController class bead handles mouse events on the org.apache.royale.jewel.Spinner's component buttons, changing the value of the Spinner.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controllers.TableCellSelectionMouseController
classes.description: The TableCellSelectionMouseController class is a controller for org.apache.royale.jewel.Table.  Controllers watch for events from the interactive portions of a View and update the data model or dispatch a semantic event. This controller watches for events from the item renderers and updates an ITableModel (which only supports single selection).  Other controller/model pairs would support various kinds of multiple selection.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controllers.TableKeyDownController
classes.description: The Jewel TableKeyDownController class is a key controller for org.apache.royale.jewel.Table.  This is just a dummy implementation for now, will be fully implemented soon

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controllers.VirtualListKeyDownController
classes.description: The Jewel ListSingleSelectionMouseController class is a controller for org.apache.royale.jewel.List.  Controllers watch for events from the interactive portions of a View and update the data model or dispatch a semantic event. This controller watches for events from the item renderers and updates an ISelectionModel (which only supports single selection).  Other controller/model pairs would support various kinds of multiple selection.  Jewel controller takes into account if the component

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controllers.WizardController
classes.description: The WizardController class is the controller for org.apache.royale.jewel.Wizard.  Controllers watch for events from the interactive portions of a View and update the data model or dispatch a semantic event.  This controller watches for the click event in previous/next buttons and makes the wizard navigate to the corresponding view updates the selection model accordingly.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.Badge
classes.description: The Badge class provides a small status descriptors for UI elements.  A Badge is an onscreen notification element consists of a small circle, typically containing a number or other characters, that appears in proximity to another object

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.Disabled
classes.description: The Disabled bead class is a specialty bead that can be used to disable a Jewel control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.DispatchChangeOnStartup
classes.description: The DispatchChangeOnStartup bead class is a specialty bead that can be used with components that implements ISelectionModel and uses dataProvider to dispatch a CHANGE event when the component is initialized

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.MultiLine
classes.description: The MultiLine bead is a specialty bead that can be used with any IClassSelectorListSupport control to allow more than one line i.e: Button, DropDownList, ... Note that Label has multiline property baked since is very used on that component

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.NavigationActionNotifier
classes.description: The NavigationActionNotifier notifies when a control's "change" or "click" event is thrown Other application parts can listen for "navigationAction" event to respond accordingly.  This bead should be used with Navigation, TabBar or a Button (that could be located in TobAppBar) or any other navigation component that triggers some navigation action  An example of use case is to use with CleanValidationErrors bead

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.ResponsiveSize
classes.description: The ResponsiveSize bead class is a specialty bead that can be used to change the size of a Jewel control depending on responsiveness.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.SizeControl
classes.description: The SizeControl bead class is a specialty bead that can be used to size a Jewel control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.TextAlign
classes.description: The TextAlign bead class is a specialty bead that make text align left, right or center.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.ToolTip
classes.description: The ToolTip class is a specialty bead that can be used with any control. The bead floats a string over a control if the user hovers over the control with a mouse.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.application.CleanValidationErrors
classes.description: The CleanValidationErrors listen for "navigationAction" event signaling some navigation was performed and we want to clean all validation errors in that could be left in the previous content

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.button.InputButtonSize
classes.description: The InputButtonSize class implements input button size for controls like CheckBox or RadioButton that need to size the selectable button part.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.button.ResponsiveLabelVisibility
classes.description: The ResponsiveLabelVisibility bead class is a specialty bead that can be used to show or hide the label text of a Button depending on responsive rules.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.combobox.ComboBoxDisabled
classes.description: The ComboBoxDisabled bead class is a specialty bead that can be used to disable a Jewel ComboBox.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.combobox.ComboBoxTextPrompt
classes.description: The ComboBoxTextPrompt class is a specialty bead that can be used with any ComboBox control. The bead places a string into the sub TextInput component when there is no value associated with the text property.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.combobox.ComboBoxTruncateText
classes.description: The ComboBoxTruncateText class is a specialty bead that can be used with a Jewel ComboBox control. The bead truncate the text when no space is available using "..."

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.combobox.ComboLowerCase
classes.description: The ComboLowerCase class is a specialty bead that can be used with a Jewel ComboBox control. The bead makes all text change to lower case Note: if you only need text to look lower case but wants the text remain unchanged you can use CSS text-transform: lowercase

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.combobox.ComboUpperCase
classes.description: The ComboUpperCase class is a specialty bead that can be used with a Jewel ComboBox control. The bead makes all text change to upper case Note: if you only need text to look upper case but wants the text remain unchanged you can use CSS text-transform: uppercase

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.combobox.IComboBoxView
classes.description: The IComboBoxView interface provides the protocol for any bead that creates the visual parts for a org.apache.royale.jewel.ComboBox control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.combobox.SearchFilter
classes.description: The SearchFilter bead class is a specialty bead that can be used with a Jewel ComboBox to filter options as we type

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.datagrid.DataGridColumnLabelsChange
classes.description: The DataGridColumnLabelsChange bead class is a specialty bead that can be use with a Jewel DataGrid control when need to change column labels at runtime.  Users can change labels throught datagrid presentation model "columnLabels" Array

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.datefield.DateFieldDisabled
classes.description: The DateFieldDisabled bead class is a specialty bead that can be used to disable a Jewel DateField control. This disables all the internal native controls.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.datefield.DateFieldMaskedTextInput
classes.description: The DateFieldMaskedTextInput class is a specialty bead that is used by DateField control. The bead mask the input of the user to conform to numbers and slashes in the following pattern: 'NN/NN/NNNN'

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.datefield.DateFieldTextPrompt
classes.description: The DateFieldTextPrompt class is a specialty bead that can be used with any DateField control. The bead places a string into the sub TextInput component when there is no value associated with the text property.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.datefield.SpanishDateComponentConfig
classes.description: The SpanishDateFieldConfig class is a specialty bead that is used by DateField or DateChooser control to configure to Spanish. You can use in combination with DateFormatDDMMYYYY Formatter

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.drawer.HideDrawerOnMouseDown
classes.description: The HideDrawerOnMouseDown can be used with a Drawer to make sure mouse down events close an open drawer. For this bead to work the application needs to be sized to the window size. See org.apache.royale.core.BrowserResizeListener or BrowserResizeApplicationListener for a way to achieve this.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.drawer.ResponsiveDrawer
classes.description: The ResponsiveDrawer class is a bead to use with Jewel Drawer to make it fixed or float depending on the screen size.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.dropdownlist.DropDownListTextPrompt
classes.description: The DropDownListTextPrompt class is a specialty bead that can be used with any DropDownList control. It fills the prompt property in the DropDownListView

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.dropdownlist.RequireSelection
classes.description: The RequireSelection bead is a specialty bead that can be used with any DropDownList control to force a data item always be selected in the control

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.image.ClipImage
classes.description: The HorizontalListScroll bead is a specialty bead that can be used with Jewel List control and gives horizontal scroll to the list  examples of use:  CIRCLE_SHAPE <j:ClipImage shape="{ClipImage.CIRCLE_SHAPE}" radius="46" x="50" y="50" units="%"/>  - using a border: <j:ClipImage shape="{ClipImage.CIRCLE_SHAPE}" radius="46" x="50" y="50" units="%" border="1" borderColor="#666666"/>  POLYGON_SHAPE <j:ClipImage shape="{ClipImage.POLYGON_SHAPE}" units="%" points="[50,0,0,100,100,100]"/> <j:ClipImage shape="{ClipImage.POLYGON_SHAPE}" units="%" points="[20, 0, 0, 20, 30, 50, 0, 80, 20, 100, 50, 70, 80, 100, 100, 80, 70, 50, 100, 20, 80, 0, 50, 30]"/>  ELLIPSE_SHAPE <j:ClipImage shape="{ClipImage.ELLIPSE_SHAPE}" radius="46" bradius="20" x="50" y="50" units="%"/>  INSET_SHAPE <j:ClipImage shape="{ClipImage.INSET_SHAPE}" inset="[5, 20, 15, 10]" rounds="[5, 20, 0, 10]"  units="%"/>

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.list.HorizontalListScroll
classes.description: The HorizontalListScroll bead is a specialty bead that can be used with Jewel List control and gives horizontal scroll to the list

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.list.ListAlternateRowColor
classes.description: The ListAlternateRowColor bead is a specialty bead that can be used with Jewel List control to alternate the background color of every row with two colors  Note: This bead is temporal due to a bug in the css compiler that prevent add 'nth-child' rules

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.slider.ISliderView
classes.description: The ISliderView interface provides the protocol for any bead that creates the visual parts for a org.apache.royale.jewel.HSlider control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.spinner.ISpinnerView
classes.description: The ISpinnerView interface provides the protocol for any bead that creates the visual parts for a org.apache.royale.jewel.Spinner control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.tabbar.AssignTabContent
classes.description: The AssignTabContent bead class is a specialty bead that can be used with a TabBar control to assign a TabBarContent to the "content" property and bind both components to work together.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.table.TableAlternateRowColor
classes.description: The TableAlternateRowColor bead is a specialty bead that can be used with Jewel Table control to alternate the background color of every row with two colors  Note: This bead is temporal due to a bug in the css compiler that prevent add 'nth-child' rules

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.textinput.LowerCase
classes.description: The LowerCase class is a specialty bead that can be used with any Jewel TextInputBase control. The bead makes all text change to lower case Note: if you only need text to look lower case but wants the text remain unchanged you can use CSS text-transform: lowercase

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.textinput.MaxNumberCharacters
classes.description: The MaxNumberCharacters class is a specialty bead that can be used with any TextInput control. The bead set the maximun number of characters the text input can hold.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.textinput.PasswordInput
classes.description: The PasswordInput class is a specialty bead that can be used with any TextInput control. The bead secures the text input area by masking the input as it is typed.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.textinput.Restrict
classes.description: The Restrict bead class is a specialty bead that can be used with any Jewel TextInputBase control. The bead uses a reg exp pattern to validate input from user. A text property allows to configure error text.  pattern examples: Numeric ony pattern = [^0-9] Letters only pattern = [^a-zA-Z] Numeric and letters only pattern = [^0-9a-zA-Z]

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.textinput.SearchFilterForList
classes.description: The SearchFilterForList bead class is a specialty bead that can be used with a Jewel TextInput to filter options in other List component  Notice that the filtering is only visual, and the underlaying dataProvider is not filtered itself. To get a filtered view of the dataProvider you should use ArrayListView API.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.textinput.TextPrompt
classes.description: The TextPrompt class is a specialty bead that can be used with any TextInput control. The bead places a string into the input field when there is no value associated with the text property.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.textinput.TruncateText
classes.description: The TruncateText class is a specialty bead that can be used with a Jewel TextInputBase or Label control. The bead truncate the text when no space is available using "..."

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.controls.textinput.UpperCase
classes.description: The UpperCase class is a specialty bead that can be used with any Jewel TextInputBase control. The bead makes all text change to upper case Note: if you only need text to look upper case but wants the text remain unchanged you can use CSS text-transform: uppercase

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.ButtonBarItemRendererInitializer
classes.description: The ButtonBarItemRendererInitializer class initializes item renderers in ButtonBar component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.CRUDTableItemRendererFactoryForCollectionView
classes.description: This class creates itemRenderer instances from the data contained within an ICollectionView and generates the appropiate table structure with thead, tbody and table rows and cells to hold the columns and data in cells.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.ClassSelectorListHoverOnlySelectableItemRendererBead
classes.description: UnselectableElement bead prevents selection but can be hovered

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.ClassSelectorListSelectableItemRendererBead
classes.description: UnselectableElement bead prevents from text selection of html element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.DataContainerItemRendererInitializer
classes.description: The DataContainerItemRendererInitializer class initializes item renderers in DataContainer classes.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.DataGridColumnListItemRendererInitializer
classes.description: The DataGridColumnListItemRendererInitializer class initializes item renderers in list classes and use the base class of many other initializers based on lists

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.DropDownListItemRendererFactoryForCollectionView
classes.description: This class creates itemRenderer instances from the data contained within an ICollectionView

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.DropDownListItemRendererInitializer
classes.description: The DropDownListItemRendererInitializer class initializes item renderers in DropDownList classes.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.IAlignItemRenderer
classes.description: The IAlignItemRenderer interface is the interface for for org.apache.royale.core.IItemRenderer that display text aligned.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.ITextItemRenderer
classes.description: The ITextItemRenderer interface is the interface for for org.apache.royale.core.IItemRenderer that display text.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.IndexedItemRendererInitializer
classes.description: The IndexedItemRendererInitializer class initializes jewel item renderers adding paddings and other needs.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.ListItemRendererInitializer
classes.description: The ListItemRendererInitializer class initializes item renderers in list classes and use the base class of many other initializers based on lists

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.NavigationItemRendererInitializer
classes.description: The NavigationItemRendererInitializer class initializes item renderers in Navigation component.  By Default this works the same as ListItemRendererInitializer, but create a placeholder for it.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.NoClassSelectorListSelectableItemRendererBead
classes.description: NoClassSelectorListRuntimeSelectableItemRendererBead bead disables selection visuals

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.NoHoverClassSelectorListSelectableItemRendererBead
classes.description: NoHoverClassSelectorListSelectableItemRendererBead bead disables hover visuals

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.RemoveAllDataGridItemRendererForArrayListData
classes.description: Handles the removal of all itemRenderer in a DataGrid component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.RemoveAllItemRendererForArrayListData
classes.description: Handles the removal of all itemRenderers. This works the same for List and Table components

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.TabBarItemRendererInitializer
classes.description: The TabBarItemRendererInitializer class initializes item renderers in TabBar component.  By Default this works the same as ListItemRendererInitializer, but create a placeholder for it.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.TableItemRendererFactoryForCollectionView
classes.description: This class creates itemRenderer instances from the data contained within an ICollectionView and generates the appropiate table structure with thead, tbody and table rows and cells to hold the columns and data in cells.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.TableItemRendererInitializer
classes.description: The TableItemRendererInitializer class initializes item renderers in Table component.  By Default this works the same as ListItemRendererInitializer, but create a placeholder for it.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.itemRenderers.VirtualDataItemRendererFactoryForCollectionView
classes.description: The VirtualDataItemRendererFactoryForCollectionView class reads an array of data and creates an item renderer for every item in the array.  Other implementations of IDataProviderItemRendererMapper map different data structures or manage a virtual set of renderers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.BasicLayout
classes.description: The BasicLayout class is a simple layout bead.  It takes the set of children and lays them out as specified by CSS properties like left, right, top and bottom.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.ButtonBarLayout
classes.description: The Jewel ButtonBarLayout class bead sizes and positions the button elements that make up a org.apache.royale.jewel.ButtonBar.
