This bead arranges the Buttons horizontally and makes them all the same width (widthType = NaN) unless the buttonWidths property has been set in which case the values stored in that array are used.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.DataGridColumnLayout
classes.description: The Jewel ButtonBarLayout class bead sizes and positions the button elements that make up a org.apache.royale.jewel.ButtonBar.  This bead arranges the Buttons horizontally and makes them all the same width (widthType = NaN) unless the buttonWidths property has been set in which case the values stored in that array are used.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.DataGridLayout
classes.description: DataGridLayout is a class that handles the size and positioning of the elements of a DataGrid. This includes the ButtonBar used for the column headers and the Lists that are the columns.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.FormItemLayout
classes.description: The BasicLayout class is a simple layout bead.  It takes the set of children and lays them out as specified by CSS properties like left, right, top and bottom.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.FormLayout
classes.description: The BasicLayout class is a simple layout bead.  It takes the set of children and lays them out as specified by CSS properties like left, right, top and bottom.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.GapConstants
classes.description: Jewel GapConstants must to be synced with _layout.sass values

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.GridCellLayout
classes.description: The GridCellLayout class is the layout used for childrens in a Grid

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.GridLayout
classes.description: The GridLayout class sets its childrens in a grid with cells filling all the available space. The cells can be separated by gap.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.HorizontalCenteredLayout
classes.description: The HorizontalCenteredLayout class is a simple layout bead similar to HorizontalLayout, but it adds support for padding and gap values.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.HorizontalFlowLayout
classes.description: The HorizontalFlowLayout class is a simple layout bead similar to HorizontalLayout, but it adds support for padding and gap values.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.HorizontalLayout
classes.description: The HorizontalLayout class is a horizontal layout bead similar to SimpleHorizontalLayout, but add support for gap values.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.IGap
classes.description: Jewel IGap is the interface used by Jewel Layouts that implement gaps.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.IVariableRowHeight
classes.description: Jewel IVariableRowHeight is the interface used by Jewel Layouts that implement gaps.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.LayoutChildren
classes.description: The LayoutChildren class is an ILayoutChildren implememntation that indicates layout classes like StyledLayoutBase to layout childrens

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.NullLayout
classes.description: The NullLayout class is a layout class used to override other layout classes This class should be temporal and make Royale be able to pass ClassReference (null) in CSS to not use the layout defined in parent class

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.Paddings
classes.description: The Paddings class is a bead that adds padding to its host

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.ResponsiveResizeListener
classes.description: The ResponsiveResizeListener class listens for browser resizing and send events when browser cross a responsive breakpoint

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.ResponsiveVisibility
classes.description: The ResponsiveVisibility bead class is a specialty bead that can be used to show or hide a Jewel component depending on responsive rules.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.SimpleHorizontalLayout
classes.description: The SimpleHorizontalLayout class is a simple layout bead that takes the set of children and lays them out horizontally in one row. In JS we make use of the CSS flex layout rules.  Note:SWF comes from basic layouts and are not tested

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.SimpleVerticalLayout
classes.description: The SimpleVerticalLayout class is a simple layout bead that takes the set of children and lays them out horizontally in one row. In JS we make use of the CSS flex layout rules.  Note:SWF comes from basic layouts and are not tested

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.StyledLayoutBase
classes.description: The StyledLayoutBase class is an extension of LayoutBase to define various common layout features for the rest of child classes

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.TableLayout
classes.description: The TableLayout class is a simple layout bead.  It takes the set of children and lays them out as a Table.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.TileHorizontalLayout
classes.description: The TileHorizontalLayout class bead sizes and positions the elements it manages into rows and columns. The size of each element is determined either by setting TileHorizontalLayout's columnWidth and rowHeight properties, or having the tile size determined by factoring the columnCount into the area assigned for the layout.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.TileVerticalLayout
classes.description: The TileVerticalLayout class bead sizes and positions the elements it manages into rows and columns. The size of each element is determined either by setting TileVerticalLayout's columnWidth and rowHeight properties, or having the tile size determined by factoring the columnCount into the area assigned for the layout.  Notice that Vertical layout based on Flexbox has the following problems (take from : https://stackoverflow.com/questions/34480760/is-it-possible-for-flex-items-to-align-tightly-to-the-items-above-them) - It expands the container horizontally, not vertically (like the Pinterest layout). - It requires the container to have a fixed height, so the items know where to wrap. - As of this writing, it has a deficiency in all major browsers where the container doesn't expand to accommodate additional columns.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.VerticalCenteredLayout
classes.description: The VerticalCenteredLayout class is a simple layout bead similar to HorizontalLayout, but it adds support for padding and gap values.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.VerticalFlowLayout
classes.description: The VerticalFlowLayout class is a simple layout bead similar to HorizontalLayout, but it adds support for padding and gap values.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.VerticalLayout
classes.description: The VerticalLayout class is a vertical layout bead similar to SimpleVerticalLayout, but add support for gap values.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.ViewLayout
classes.description: The ViewLayout class is a layout class used in Jewel View class

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.layouts.VirtualListVerticalLayout
classes.description: The VirtualListVerticalLayout class is used for Jewel List that wants to use VirtualListView and Virtual ItemRenders.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.AlertModel
classes.description: The AlertModel class bead implements the org.apache.royale.core.IAlertModel and holds the properties for an org.apache.royale.html.Alert such the buttons to use and message to display.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.ArrayListSelectionModel
classes.description: The ArrayListSelectionModel class is a selection model for a dataProvider that is an ArrayList. It assumes that items can be fetched from the dataProvider using dataProvider.getItemAt(index).

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.ComboBoxModel
classes.description: The ComboBoxModel class bead extends org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.ArrayListSelectionModel and adds the text being displayed by the org.apache.royale.jewel.ComboBox's input field.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.ComboBoxPresentationModel
classes.description: The ComboBoxPresentationModel class contains the data to present the popup list of the org.apache.royale.jewel.ComboBox along with the rowCount, the height of the rows or the align of column labels.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.DataGridPresentationModel
classes.description: The DataGridPresentationModel class contains the data to label the columns of the org.apache.royale.jewel.DataGrid along with the height of the rows or the align of column labels.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.DataProviderModel
classes.description: The DataProviderModel class is a model for a dataProvider and an optional labelField.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.DateChooserModel
classes.description: The DateChooserModel is a bead class that manages the data for a DataChooser. This includes arrays of names for the months and days of the week as well the currently selected date.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.DropDownListModel
classes.description: The DropDownListModel class defines the data associated with an org.apache.royale.jewel.DropDownListModel component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.FormItemModel
classes.description: The FormItemModel bead class holds the values for a org.apache.royale.jewel.FormItem

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.IDropDownListModel
classes.description: The IDropDownListModel interface is a marker interface

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.IJewelSelectionModel
classes.description: The IJewelSelectionModel interface is a simple extension to core ISelectionModel

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.ImageModel
classes.description: The ImageModel class bead defines the data associated with an org.apache.royale.jewel.Image component, namely the source of the image.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.ListPresentationModel
classes.description: The ListPresentationModel holds values used by list controls for presenting their user interfaces.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.PopUpModel
classes.description: The PopUpModel class bead defines the data associated with an org.apache.royale.jewel.PopUp component. This includes the duration - how long to show the view for.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.RangeModel
classes.description: The RangeModel class bead defines a set of for a numeric range of values which includes a minimum, maximum, and current value.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.ScrollBarModel
classes.description: The ScrollBarModel class bead extends the org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.RangeModel and adds page size and page step sizes.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.SliderRangeModel
classes.description: The SliderRangeModel class bead defines a set of for a numeric range of values which includes a minimum, maximum, and current value.  It do not calculate any values for slider - just holds it.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.SnackbarModel
classes.description: The SnackbarModel class bead defines the data associated with an org.apache.royale.jewel.Snackbar component. This includes a message, the action and duration - how long to show the view for.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.TableArrayListSelectionModel
classes.description: The ArrayListSelectionModel class is a selection model for a dataProvider that is an ArrayList. It assumes that items can be fetched from the dataProvider using dataProvider.getItemAt(index).

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.TextModel
classes.description: The TextModel class is most basic data model for a component that displays text.  All Royale components that display text should also support HTML, although the Flash Player implementations may only support a subset of HTML.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.TitleBarModel
classes.description: The TitleBarModel class bead holds the values for the org.apache.royale.html.TitleBar's properties.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.WizardModel
classes.description: The WizardModel bead class holds the values for a org.apache.royale.jewel.Wizard

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.models.WizardStep
classes.description: The WizardModel bead class holds the values for a org.apache.royale.html.Panel, such as its title.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.validators.CheckBoxValidator
classes.description: The CheckBoxValidator class is a specialty bead that can be used with Group control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.validators.DateValidator
classes.description: The DateValidator class is a specialty bead that can be used with Group control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.validators.EmailValidator
classes.description: The EmailValidator class is a specialty bead that can be used with TextInput control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.validators.FormValidator
classes.description: The FormValidator class is a specialty bead that can be used with form control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.validators.RadioButtonValidator
classes.description: The RadioButtonValidator class is a specialty bead that can be used with Group control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.validators.SelectedItemNullValidator
classes.description: The SelectedItemNullValidator class is a specialty bead that can be used with Group control to validate if a component (normaly list based) has a selectedItem with null value

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.validators.StringValidator
classes.description: The StringValidator class is a specialty bead that can be used with TextInput control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.validators.Validator
classes.description: The Validator class is the base class for all validators. This class implements the ability for create/destroy error tips, user should set custom validateFunction or use sub class for validation.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.AlertView
classes.description: The AlertView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.jewel.Alert component. The job of the view bead is to put together the parts of the Alert, such as the title bar, message, and various buttons, within the space of the Alert component strand.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.ButtonBarView
classes.description: The ButtonBarView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.jewel.ButtonBar component. A ButtonBar is a type of List and ButtonBarView extends the ListView bead.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.ButtonView
classes.description: The ButtonView class is the default view for the org.apache.royale.jewel.Button class. It allows the look of the button to be expressed in CSS via the background-image style and displays a text label.  This view does not support right-to-left text.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.CheckBoxView
classes.description: The CheckBoxView class is the default view for SWF platform in the org.apache.royale.jewel.CheckBox class. It displays a simple checkbox with an 'x' if checked, and a label on the right.  There are no styles or properties to configure the look of the 'x' or the position of the label relative to the checkbox as there are no equivalents in the standard HTML checkbox.  A more complex CheckBox could implement more view configuration.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.ComboBoxPopUpView
classes.description: The ComboBoxPopUpView class is a view bead for the ComboBoxPopUp.  This class creates a list that will be pop up when the combo box needs to show the associated list

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.ComboBoxView
classes.description: The ComboBoxView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.jewel.ComboBox component. The job of the view bead is to put together the parts of the ComboBox such as the TextInput control and org.apache.royale.jewel.Button to trigger the pop-up.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.DataGridView
classes.description: The DataGridView class is the visual bead for the org.apache.royale.jewel.DataGrid. This class constructs the items that make the DataGrid: Lists for each column and a org.apache.royale.jewel.ButtonBar for the column headers.  Columns without specific columnWidths gets 1/n of the maximun space available where n is the number of columns.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.DateChooserView
classes.description: The DateChooserView class is a view bead for the DateChooser.  This class creates the elements for the DateChooser: the buttons to move between months, the labels for the days of the week, and the buttons for each day of the month.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.DateFieldView
classes.description: The DateFieldView class is a bead for DateField that creates the input and button controls. This class also handles the pop-up mechanics.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.DropDownListView
classes.description: The DropDownListView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.jewel.DropDownList component. The job of the view bead is to put together the parts of the DropDownList such as the Select

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.FormHeadingView
classes.description: The FormHeadingView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.jewel.FormHeading component. A FormHeading has two org.apache.royale.jewel.Labels.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.FormItemView
classes.description: The FormItemView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.jewel.FormItem component. A FormItem has two org.apache.royale.jewel.Label (one for text and other to show requeriment), and content.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.IScrollToIndexView
classes.description: The IListView interface provides the protocol for any bead that creates the visual parts for a org.apache.royale.jewel.List control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.ImageView
classes.description: The ImageView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.jewel.Image component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.NumericStepperView
classes.description: The NumericStepperView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.jewel.NumericStepper component. A NumberStepper consists of a org.apache.royale.jewel.TextInput component to display the value and a org.apache.royale.jewel.Spinner to change the value.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.PopUpView
classes.description: The PopUpView class is a bead for PopUp that creates the dialog that holds the real component. This class also handles the pop-up mechanics.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.RadioButtonView
classes.description: The RadioButtonView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.jewel.RadioButton for the SWF platform component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.SliderThumbView
classes.description: The SliderThumbView class creates the draggable input element for the org.apache.royale.jewel.HSlider component for the SWF platform.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.SliderTrackView
classes.description: The SliderTrackView class creates the track area for the org.apache.royale.jewel.HSlider component for the SWF platform.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.SliderView
classes.description: The SliderView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.jewel.HSlider component. The HSlider has a track and a thumb control which are also created with view beads.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.SnackbarView
classes.description: The SnackbarView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.jewel.Snackbar component. The job of the view bead is to put together the parts of the Snackbar such as the message text and action clicked dispatches action event on behalf of the Snackbar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.SpinnerView
classes.description: The SpinnerView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.jewel.Spinner component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.TabBarView
classes.description: The TabBarView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.jewel.TabBar component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.TableView
classes.description: The TableView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.jewel.Table component.  It creates a TBody, and defines THead and TFoot optional parts to be created by a mapper

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.TextFieldView
classes.description: The TextFieldView class is the default view for the org.apache.royale.jewel.Label class in the SWF platform. It displays text using a TextInput, so there is no right-to-left text support in this view.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.VirtualComboBoxPopUpView
classes.description: The VirtualComboBoxPopUpView class is a view bead for the VirtualComboBoxPopUp.  This class creates a VirtualList that will be pop up when the combo box needs to show the associated list

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.VirtualListView
classes.description: The VirtualListView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.jewel.List component in a way that can be recicled to reuse as the user scrolls the list getting performance improvements when dataproviders with lots of items are passed to the component. In This way Royale just create a few item renderers visible for the user, instead of one renderer for each item in the data provider.  A List consists of the area to display the data (in the dataGroup), any scrollbars, and so forth.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.beads.views.WizardView
classes.description: The Wizard class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.jewel.Wizard component. A Wizard has two org.apache.royale.jewel.Button, and content. The buttons navigate pages to previous or next.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.debugger.ResponsiveSizeMonitor
classes.description: The ResponsiveDrawer class is a bead to use with Jewel Drawer to make it fixed or float depending on the screen size.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.events.WizardEvent
classes.description: Programmatic (not user/UI) based wizard navigation events.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.itemRenderers.AlternateRowColorTableItemRendererInitializer
classes.description: Note: This is just an experiment. Better use TableAlternateRowColor  The TableItemRendererInitializer class initializes item renderers in Table component.  By Default this works the same as ListItemRendererInitializer, but create a placeholder for it.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.itemRenderers.ButtonBarItemRenderer
classes.description: The ButtonBarItemRenderer class extends Button and turns it into an itemRenderer suitable for use in most DataContainer/List/DataGrid applications.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.itemRenderers.CollapsibleNavigationSectionRenderer
classes.description: The NavigationLinkItemRenderer defines the basic Item Renderer for a Jewel Navigation List Component. It handles Objects with "label" and "href" data. Extend this (you can do it in MXML) to support more data like for example: icon data.  Note: This render creates a sub list, so we add in this class a concrete layout (VerticalLayout). So don't try to change layout (adding via CSS, mxml beads, etc...). For layout the renderer parts, use a container (i.e: HGroup, VGroup,...)

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.itemRenderers.DataGridItemRenderer
classes.description: The DataGridItemRenderer defines the basic Item Renderer for a Jewel DataGrid Component. For now is just a ListItemRenderer that populates some values from Jewel DataGridColumn.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.itemRenderers.DatagridHeaderRenderer
classes.description: The DatagridHeaderRenderer class extends ButtonBarItemRenderer and turns it into an itemRenderer suitable for use in most DataContainer/List/DataGrid applications.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.itemRenderers.DateItemRenderer
classes.description: The DateItemRenderer class renders date values for the DateChooser.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.itemRenderers.DropDownListItemRenderer
classes.description: The DropDownListItemRenderer class creates a DropDownList menu item

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.itemRenderers.IconButtonBarItemRenderer
classes.description: The IconButtonBarItemRenderer class extends IconButton and turns it into an itemRenderer suitable for use in most DataContainer/List/DataGrid applications.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.itemRenderers.ListItemRenderer
classes.description: The ListItemRenderer defines the basic Item Renderer for a Jewel List Component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.itemRenderers.NavigationLinkItemRenderer
classes.description: The NavigationLinkItemRenderer defines the basic Item Renderer for a Jewel Navigation List Component. It handles Objects with "label" and "href" data. Extend this (you can do it in MXML) to support more data like for example: icon data.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.itemRenderers.StringItemRenderer
classes.description: The StringItemRenderer class displays data in string form using the data's toString() function.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.itemRenderers.TabBarButtonInidicatorRestrictedToContentItemRenderer
classes.description: The TabBarButtonInidicatorRestrictedToContentItemRenderer is a TabBarButtonItemRenderer that restrict indicator to content

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.itemRenderers.TabBarButtonItemRenderer
classes.description: The TabBarButtonItemRenderer defines the basic Item Renderer for a Jewel TabBar List Component. It handles Objects with "label" and "href" data. Extend this (you can do it in MXML) to support more data like for example: icon data.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.itemRenderers.TableItemRenderer
classes.description: The TableItemRenderer class displays data in string form using the data's toString() function.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.itemRenderers.ToggleButtonBarItemRenderer
classes.description: The ButtonBarItemRenderer class extends Button and turns it into an itemRenderer suitable for use in most DataContainer/List/DataGrid applications.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.IInputButton
classes.description: IInputButton is the interface that implements controls like CheckBox and RadioButton that owns a button input part

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.INavigationRenderer
classes.description: INavigationRenderer is the interface that all item renderers used with Navigation List component must implement. Jewel supports a basic implementation with NavigationLinkItemRenderer

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.ISelectableContent
classes.description: ISelectableContent is the interface a container implements to mark as the current selected content

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.NoViewport
classes.description: NoViewport is set when we need to avoid default Viewport in Container

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.ResponsiveSizes
classes.description: The ResponsiveSizes declares consants that are related to SASS variables created to provide media queries for different screen sizes  by default:  // DEVICE DIMENSIONS $phone: 0px $tablet: 768px $desktop: 992px $widescreen: 1200px

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.Viewport
classes.description: A Viewport is the area of a Container set aside for displaying content. If the content exceeds the visible area of the viewport it will be clipped or hidden.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.bar.BarRow
classes.description: The BarRow class is a container to organize content in a row. Is used with Bar, TopAppBar or CardHeader and CardActions. It represent a row. More than one row can be suported.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.bar.BarSection
classes.description: The BarSection class is a container component for items in an Bar or TopAppBar row.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.bar.BarTitle
classes.description: The BarTitle class is the title to use with a Bar or TopAppBar. The later use to be the application title

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.button.SelectableButtonBase
classes.description: The SelectableButtonBase is a support class (not for direct use) and implements the ISelectable interface to be override in subclasses. Jewel CheckBox and RadioButtons are direct extensions of this class.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.button.SimpleButton
classes.description: The Jewel SimpleButton class is a simple button.  Use Jewel Button for buttons that should show text.  SimpleButton is a commonly used rectangular button. It looks like it can be pressed and allow users to take actions, and make choices, with a single click or tap. It typically use event listeners to perform an action when the user interact with the control. When a user clicks the mouse or tap with the finger this control it dispatches a click event.  This is the lightest weight button used for non-text buttons like the arrow buttons in a Scrollbar or NumericStepper.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.card.CardActions
classes.description: The CardActions class is a footer for Cards where actions (i.e: buttons, icons) use to be located.  Actions are placed horizontally by default, and can be separated using BarSection for left, middle and right sections.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.card.CardExpandedContent
classes.description: The CardExpandedContent class is a container that expand inner content removing paddings. This could be convinient for content that needs to avoid gaps with the surronding container.  For example a Jewel TabBar or Navigation that needs to fill all the available space.  Content are placed vertically by default.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.card.CardHeader
classes.description: The CardHeader class is a header used in Jewel Card component where title, icons or actions (i.e: buttons, icons) can be located.  Actions are placed horizontally by default, and can be separated using BarSection for left, middle and right sections.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.card.CardPrimaryContent
classes.description: The CardPrimaryContent class is a the main content container for Cards. Adding this container means we want a more complex card structure.  Content are placed vertically by default.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.card.CardTitle
classes.description: The CardTitle class is a header title for Cards that can be used inside CardHeader or direclty inside Card.  It adds some styling to labels used as titles for Cards.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.combobox.ComboBoxPopUp
classes.description: The ComboBoxPopUp class is the popup that holds the List used internally by ComboBox as the dropdown/popup.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.combobox.IComboBoxPresentationModel
classes.description: The Jewel IComboBoxPresentationModel interface holds key values for the display a Jewel ComboBox.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.combobox.VirtualComboBoxPopUp
classes.description: The VirtualComboBoxPopUp class is the popup that holds the VirtualList used internally by VirtualComboBox as the dropdown/popup.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.container.AlignmentItemsContainer
classes.description: The Jewel AlignmentItemsGroup class is the base class for groups that unlike normal Jewel Group class that positions elements in a the canvas wants to follow a concret layout algorithm like Horizontal or Vertical layouts. that can make its items to distribute in different ways normally HGroup and VGroup.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.container.AlignmentItemsContainerWithGap
classes.description: The Jewel AlignmentItemsGroup class is the base class for groups that unlike normal Jewel Group class that positions elements in a the canvas wants to follow a concret layout algorithm like Horizontal or Vertical layouts. that can make its items to distribute in different ways normally HGroup and VGroup.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.container.ContainerBase
classes.description: The ContainerBase class is the base class for most containers in Royale.  It is usable as the root tag of MXML documents and UI controls and containers are added to it.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.container.DataContainerBase
classes.description: The DataContainerBase class is the base class for components that that have generated content, like lists.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.container.StyledContainerContentArea
classes.description: The ContainerContentArea class implements the contentView for a Container on the SWF platform.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.datagrid.DataGridButtonBar
classes.description: The DataGridButtonBar class extends ButtonBar and provides a class for styling the header region of the DataGrid.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.datagrid.DataGridColumn
classes.description: The DataGridColumn class is the collection of properties that describe a column of the org.apache.royale.jewel.DataGrid: which renderer to use for each cell in the column, the width of the column, the label for the column, and the name of the field in the data containing the value to display in the column.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.datagrid.DataGridColumnList
classes.description: The DataGridColumnList class is the List class used internally by DataGrid for each column.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.datagrid.DataGridColumnWidth
classes.description: internal use only

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.datagrid.DataGridWidthDenominator
classes.description: internal use only

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.datagrid.IDataGridColumn
classes.description: Jewel IDataGridColumn is the interface used by Jewel DataGridColumn in the Jewel DataGrid.  Define which renderer to use for each cell in the column, and other optional data like the width, the label (used in header), and the name of the field in the data containing the value to display in the column (for the simplest ItemRenderer).

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.datagrid.IDataGridColumnList
classes.description: The Jewel IDataGridColumnList interface is a marker interface for Jewel DataGrid Column Lists

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.datagrid.IDataGridPresentationModel
classes.description: The Jewel IDataGridPresentationModel interface holds key values for the display a Jewel DataGrid.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.drawer.DrawerBase
classes.description: The DrawerBase class is the base class for a container component used for navigation.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.drawer.DrawerContent
classes.description: The DrawerContent class is a container component used in a Drawer to hold content like navigation, icons, or text.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.drawer.DrawerFooter
classes.description: The DrawerFooter class is a BarRow component to use as the last content in a Drawer.  The styling of this component is similar to the FooterBar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.drawer.DrawerHeader
classes.description: The DrawerHeader class is a container component to hold drawer header content, like a title or an image icon logo

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.dropdownlist.DropDownListList
classes.description: The DropDownListList class is the List class used internally by DropDownList as the dropdown/popup.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.formitem.FormItemLayoutProxy
classes.description: The FormItemLayoutProxy class is used by Wizard in order for layouts to operate on the Wizard itself. If Wizard were being used, its numElements, getElementAt, etc. functions would actually redirect to its Container content. In order for a layout to work on the Wizard directly (its PreviousButton, NextButton and Container), this proxy is used which will invoke the Wizard's $numElements, $getElementAt, etc functions.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.group.AlignmentItemsGroup
classes.description: The Jewel AlignmentItemsGroup class is the base class for groups that distribute items along one of its axis. Used extensions are normally HGroup and VGroup.  Unlike normal Jewel Group class that positions elements in a canvas using x and y this class and its extensions use to follow a concret layout algorithm (like Horizontal or Vertical layouts) and need to distribute its items in different ways.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.group.AlignmentItemsGroupWithGap
classes.description: The Jewel AlignmentItemsGroupWithGap class is the base class for groups that need to distribute its items in different ways and support gaps.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.group.GroupBase
classes.description: The Jewel GroupBase class is the base class for most simple containers in Royale. It is usable as the root tag of MXML documents and UI controls and containers are added to it.  Unlike Basic version that inherits from UIBase, this class inherits from StyledUIBase that's the main class for Jewel components and containers

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.list.DataGroup
classes.description: The DataGroup class is the IItemRendererOwnerView used internally by org.apache.royale.jewel.List class.  Unlike Flex, this component is only used by List in the SWF platform. In JS you should use a Jewel DataContainer

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.list.IListPresentationModel
classes.description: The Jewel IListPresentationModel interface holds key values for the display of lists.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.popup.PopUpContent
classes.description: The PopUpContent class is a component

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.radiobutton.RadioButtonIcon
classes.description: The RadioButton class is a component that displays a selectable Button. RadioButtons are typically used in groups, identified by the groupName property. RadioButton use the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the groupName. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the RadioButton..

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.scrollbar.HScrollBar
classes.description: The ScrollBar class represents either a vertical or horizontal control that allows the user to quickly scan through a component that does not wholly fit within its container.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.scrollbar.ScrollBar
classes.description: The ScrollBar class represents either a vertical or horizontal control that allows the user to quickly scan through a component that does not wholly fit within its container.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.scrollbar.VScrollBar
classes.description: The ScrollBar class represents either a vertical or horizontal control that allows the user to quickly scan through a component that does not wholly fit within its container.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.table.ITableColumn
classes.description: Jewel ITableColumn is the interface used by Jewel TableColumn in the Jewel Table.  Define which renderer to use for each cell in the table, and other optional data like the width, the label (used in header), and the name of the field in the data containing the value to display in the column (for the simplest ItemRenderer).

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.table.TBody
classes.description: The TBody class is a building block of Jewel SimpleTable and Table components, is used in TableView and represents an HTML <tbody> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.table.TBodyContentArea
classes.description: The TBodyContentArea class is a building block of Jewel SimpleTable and Table components, is used in TableView and represents an HTML <tbody> element.  The body part in a table use to be the "data" part and can be scrollable for this reason is implemented as a ContainerContentArea and provided via CSS as the IContentView.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.table.TFoot
classes.description: The TFoot class is a building block of Jewel SimpleTable and Table components, is used in TableView and represents an HTML <tfoot> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.table.THead
classes.description: The THead class is a building block of Jewel SimpleTable and Table components, is used in TableView and represents an HTML <thead> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.table.TableCell
classes.description: The TableCell class defines a table data cell in the Table component. This element may have nearly any type of Royale component as children.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.table.TableColumn
classes.description: TableColumn define a column for a Jewel Table component with special table properties.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.table.TableHeaderCell
classes.description: The TableHeaderCell class defines a table header cell in the Table component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.table.TableRow
classes.description: The TableRow class is a building block of Jewel SimpleTable and Table components, is used in TableView and represents an HTML <tr> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.textinput.ITextInput
classes.description: ITextInput is the interface for all text input jewel classes. It's used mainly in org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.textinput.TextInputBase

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.textinput.TextInputBase
classes.description: The TextInputBase class is the base class for TextInput and TextArea Jewel controls. Implements text and html properties and change event.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.tooltip.ErrorTipLabel
classes.description: The ErrorTipLabel class is the control used for ToolTip bead to popup an error text over a control

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.tooltip.ToolTipLabel
classes.description: The ToolTipLabel class is the control used for ToolTip bead to popup a text over a control

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.validators.CreditCardValidatorCardType
classes.description: The CreditCardValidatorCardType class defines value constants for specifying the type of credit card to validate. These values are used in the CreditCardValidator.cardType property.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.view.ViewBase
classes.description: The Jewel ViewBase class is the base class for most views in a Royale Jewel application.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jewel.supportClasses.wizard.WizardLayoutProxy
classes.description: The WizardLayoutProxy class is used by Wizard in order for layouts to operate on the Wizard itself. If Wizard were being used, its numElements, getElementAt, etc. functions would actually redirect to its Container content. In order for a layout to work on the Wizard directly (its PreviousButton, NextButton and Container), this proxy is used which will invoke the Wizard's $numElements, $getElementAt, etc functions.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.jquery.ToggleTextButton
classes.description: The ToggleButton class is a TextButton that supports a selected property.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.maps.google.GoogleMap
classes.description: The Map class displays a Google Map centered on lat/lng coordinates. The Map uses the following bead type:  org.apache.royale.maps.beads.MapView: Uses HTMLLoader to display the map.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.maps.google.beads.GoogleMapView
classes.description: The AS3 version of GoogleMapView is geared toward its use with HTMLLoader for AIR.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.maps.google.models.MapModel
classes.description: The data model for the Map class, this holds the maps current center location, its current zoom level, the last marker selected, and any search results.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.DatePicker
classes.description: The DatePicker presents a control for picking a date.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.IViewManager
classes.description: The IViewManager interface is implemented by classes that manage or control IViews.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.IViewManagerView
classes.description: The IViewManagerView interface is implemented by any class that can be managed by an IViewManager.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.ManagerBase
classes.description: The ManagerBase is a base class for mobile display managers such as StackedViewManager and TabbedViewManager. This class encapsulates the features common to all view managers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.StackedViewManager
classes.description: The StackedViewManager displays a single View at a time from a collection of Views where views[0] is at the bottom and views[n-1] is at the top and displayed.  The StackedViewManager has an optional navigation bar at the top and an optional tool bar at the bottom. The views are displayed within the StackedViewManager's content area.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.TabbedViewManager
classes.description: The TabbedViewManager displays a set of views, only one of which is active at a time. The other views are reachable via a set of tab buttons at the bottom of the view manager's space.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.TitleView
classes.description: The TitleView class represents a view in a mobile app that has a title and is typically used in a ViewManager.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.ToggleSwitch
classes.description: The ToggleSwitch is a UI control that displays on/off or yes/no states.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.ViewManagerBase
classes.description: Base class for mobile navigation controls.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.beads.DatePickerView
classes.description: The DatePickerView bead creates the visual elements of the DatePicker. This is a set of three RangeSteppers (one each for month, day, and year).

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.beads.DeviceSizeBead
classes.description: The DeviceSizeBead.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.beads.MobileWebBrowserView
classes.description: The MobileWebBrowserView creates an instance of StageWebView to load web pages into a mobile application. This class is available only for AS3 compiled mode. Note that StageWebView is attached directly to the stage and may obscure other components.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.beads.StackedViewManagerView
classes.description: The StackedViewManagerView creates the visual elements of the StackedViewManager. This includes a NavigationBar, ToolBar, and contentArea.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.beads.TabbedViewManagerView
classes.description: The TabbedViewManagerView constructs the visual elements of the TabbedViewManager. The elements may be a navigation bar, a tab bar, and the contentArea.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.beads.ToggleSwitchView
classes.description: The ToggleSwitchView creates the element used to display the ToggleSwitch interface.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.beads.TopTabbedViewManagerView
classes.description: The TopTabbedViewManagerView constructs the visual elements of the TabbedViewManager. It always contains a tab bar and it's located at the top. It may contain a navigation bar at the bottom.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.beads.ViewManagerViewBase
classes.description: The ViewManagerViewBase creates the visual elements of the StackedViewManager. This includes a NavigationBar, ToolBar, and contentArea.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.beads.controllers.ToggleSwitchMouseController
classes.description: The ToggleSwitchMouseController bead handles mouse events on the ToggleSwitch, allowing the user to use the mouse to change the state of the ToggleSwitch.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.chrome.NavigationBar
classes.description: The NavigationBar class is part of the mobile view manager's chrome. When present, it provides a place for content at the top of the view, above the contentArea.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.chrome.TabBar
classes.description: The TabBar class displays a set of buttons that can be used to switch between navigation panels.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.chrome.ToolBar
classes.description: The ToolBar class provides a space below the contentArea of a view manager which can be used to house controls for the view.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.mobile.models.ViewManagerModel
classes.description: The ViewManagerModel houses properties and values common to the components which make up view managers. These properties include the title, which view is currently active and selected.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.net.BinaryUploader
classes.description: The BinaryUploader class is a class designed to upload binary data over HTTP.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.net.CompressedRemoteObject
classes.description: A RemoteObject that performs automatic serialization/deserialization of results.  It deserializes the compressed ByteArray in order to optimize the transfer time. TOOD improve to serialize the sending.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.net.HTTPHeader
classes.description: The data class for HTTP headers in HTTP server communications.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.net.HTTPService
classes.description: The HTTPService class is a class designed to transfer text over HTTP.  Use BinaryUploader for transferring non-text.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.net.HTTPServiceBase
classes.description: The data class for HTTP headers in HTTP server communications.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.net.RemoteObject
classes.description: This is the RemoteObject that has a similar behaviour that Flex RemoteObject and can be use with BlazeDS, LCDS or CF backends

classes.name: org.apache.royale.net.SimpleRemoteObject
classes.description: This is the most simple implementation os a RemoteObject it can be use with simple backends like AMFPHP. To use with BlazeDS better us RemoteObject since it manages clientId and small messages

classes.name: org.apache.royale.net.URLBinaryLoader
classes.description: The URLBinaryLoader class is a relatively low-level class designed to get binary data over HTTP the intent is to create similar classes for text and URL vars.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.net.URLBinaryUploader
classes.description: The URLBinaryUploader class subclasses URLBinaryLoader to offer upload progress events.  This class is only used for JS implementations because Flash upload events need to be handled differently. In Flash, URLLoader does not dispatch upload events. It only dispatches download events. To get upload events in Flash, you need to use File/FileReference.upload() and attach event listeners to that.  Care should be taken when using this class because it attaches a progress listener to the xhr.upload object. Doing so causes browsers to send OPTIONS requests. This will return an unauthorized response from servers not configured to allow CORS OPTIONS requests. See this S.O. post for details. https://stackoverflow.com/a/17057853

classes.name: org.apache.royale.net.URLLoader
classes.description: The URLBinaryLoader class is a relatively low-level class designed to get binary data over HTTP the intent is to create similar classes for text and URL vars. If you need to use Binary requests (including POST), use URLBinaryLoader.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.net.URLLoaderBase
classes.description: The URLLoader class is a base class for the specific flavors of loaders such as binary, text or variables

classes.name: org.apache.royale.net.URLRequest

classes.name: org.apache.royale.net.URLStream

classes.name: org.apache.royale.net.URLUploadStream
classes.description: The URLUploadStream extends the URLStream class to support upload progress events.  This class is only used for JS implementations because Flash upload events need to be handled differently. In Flash, URLLoader does not dispatch upload events. It only dispatches download events. To get upload events in Flash, you need to use File/FileReference.upload() and attach event listeners to that.  Care should be taken when using this class because it attaches a progress listener to the xhr.upload object. Doing so causes browsers to send OPTIONS requests. This will return an unauthorized response from servers not configured to allow CORS OPTIONS requests. See this S.O. post for details. https://stackoverflow.com/a/17057853

Abstract base class for all messages. Messages have two customizable sections; headers and body. The headers property provides access to specialized meta information for a specific message instance. The headers property is an associative array with the specific header name as the key.

The body of a message contains the instance specific data that needs to be delivered and processed by the remote destination. The body is an object and is the payload for a message.

Note: readExternal and writeExternal methods compile but are not tested and maybe not work but is an initial work

classes.name: org.apache.royale.routing.BrowserRouter
classes.description: BrowserRouter is a bead which automatically handles browsing history. It could be attached to any strand, but typically it would be attached to Application or View Listen to stateChange events to handle changes to browsing history and use setState and renderState for modifying the history. The state of the router can be modified before committing the state changes. The difference between HashRouter and BrowserRouter is that HashRouter uses the location hash which is only the section from "#" and on. BrowserRouter uses path routes which are indistinguishable from normal urls. Both Router implementations can use a hash for scroll positioning beads.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.routing.ComponentRoute

It could be attached to any strand, but typically it would be attached to Application or View Listen to stateChange events to handle changes to browsing history and use setState and renderState for modifying the history. The state of the router can be modified before committing the state changes. The difference between HashRouter and BrowserRouter is that HashRouter uses the location hash which is only the section from "#" and on. BrowserRouter uses path routes which are indistinguishable from normal urls. Both Router implementations can use a hash for scroll positioning beads.

classes.description: The LocalStorage class allows apps to store small amounts of data locally, in the browser's permitted storage area. This data will persist between browser invocations. The data is stored in key=value pairs.  This class uses the ValuesManager to determine a storage provider - an implementation class the actually does the storing and retrieving. To change the provider implementation, set a ClassReference for the LocalStorage CSS style. The default is the org.apache.royale.storage.providers.LocalStorageProvider class.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.storage.events.FileEvent
classes.description: The FileEvent class is used to signal varies events in the life and use of permanent files.  READY    - The file has been created or opened successfully. READ     - Some (or all) of the data has been read. WRITE    - Some (or all) of the data has been written. COMPLETE - The read or write process has finished and the file is closed. ERROR    - An error occurred reading or opening the file.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.test.runners.ITestRunner
classes.description: An interface for test runner implementations, such as MetadataRunner and SuiteRunner.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.test.runners.MetadataRunner
classes.description:
Runs a class containing methods marked with [Test] metadata.

Also supports the following optional metadata:

  • Tests with [Ignore] metadata should be ignored (skipped).
  • Methods with [Before] metadata are run before every individual test.
  • Methods with [After] metadata are run after every individual test.
  • Static methods with [BeforeClass] metadata are run one time, before the first test.
  • Static methods with [AfterClass] metadata are run one time, after the final test.

To test asynchronous functionality, add the async modifier to the [Test] metadata, and use the static methods on the org.apache.royale.test.async.Async class to set up a context for testing asynchronously.

[Test(async)]

By default, asynchronous tests fail if they do not complete within 500 milliseconds. Set the timeout modifier on the [Test] metadata to customize this duration (measured in milliseconds).

[Test(async,timeout="2000")]

To require that a specific exception is thrown while a test is running, set the `expected` modifier on the `[Test]` metadata to the name of the exception class.

[Test(expected="RangeError")]

classes.name: org.apache.royale.test.runners.SuiteRunner
classes.description:
A runner for test suites.

Test suites should be annotated with [Suite] and [RunWith("org.apache.royale.test.runners.SuiteRunner")] metadata. To add test classes to the suite, define a public variable for each class, using the class as the variable type. You may also add other suite classes in the same way.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.text.engine.FontMetrics
classes.description: The FontMetrics class contains metrics specific to the font. The information contained in this class is all located in the OS/2 font table. It is important to note that there can be two distinct uses for this class. By default IFont has a FontMetrics which contains the raw data which is dependent on unitsPerEm. Clients would usually need a FontMetrics which is calculated based on a specific font size.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.text.events.TextEvent
classes.description:
A TextLayoutEvent instance represents an event, such as the TextLayoutEvent.SCROLL event, that does not require custom properties.

A scroll event is represented by a TextLayoutEvent instance with its type property set to TextLayoutEvent.SCROLL. A class specifically for scroll events is not necessary because there are no custom properties for a scroll event, as there are for the other events that have specific event classes. If a new text layout event is needed, and the event does not require custom properties, the new event will also be represented by a TextLayoutEvent object, but with its type property set to a new static constant.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.text.ime.CompositionAttributeRange
classes.description:
The CompositionAttributeRange class represents a range of composition attributes for use with IME events. For example, when editing text in the IME, the text is divided by the IME into composition ranges. These composition ranges are flagged as selected (i.e. currently being lengthened, shortened, or edited), and/or converted (i.e. they have made one pass through the IME dictionary lookup already).

By convention, the client should adorn these composition ranges with underlining or hiliting according to the flags.

For example:

!converted = thick gray underline (raw text) !selected && converted = thin black underline selected && converted = thick black underline

classes.name: org.apache.royale.text.ime.IIMEClient
classes.description:
Interface for IME (input method editor) clients. Components based on the org.apache.royale.text.engine package must implement this interface to support editing text inline using an IME. This interface is not used with TextField objects. TextLayoutFramework (TLF) uses this interface to support inline IME, so clients using TLF do not need to implement this interface.

To support inline IME, set the imeClient property of an ImeEvent.IME_START_COMPOSITION event to an object which implements this interface.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.text.ime.IIMESupport
classes.description: The IIMESupport interface defines the interface for any component that supports IME (input method editor). IME is used for entering characters in Chinese, Japanese, and Korean.
